original: thams cad du khyab par dmigs zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: thams cad du khyab par dmigs zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of “pervading all” is that it is perceived as all-pervading.

original: thams cad yang dag par 'du ba ni dran pa der stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag par 'du ba ni dran pa der stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “All are gathered” means that all the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers and the fearlessnesses, are gathered in that mindfulness.

original: tshim par byed pa ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing sems can dang bskyed par byed pa'o /
analyzed: tshim par byed pa ni sems can la phan 'dogs shing sems can dang bskyed par byed pa'o /
translated: “Satisfying” means that it benefits sentient beings and generates sentient beings.

original: pham par byed pa ni bdud thams cad 'joms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pham par byed pa ni bdud thams cad 'joms par byed pa'o //
translated: “Conquering” means that it conquers all demons.

original: rtogs par byed pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gis rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rang gis rig par byed pa'o //
translated: “Realizing” means that it is the nonconceptual wisdom that is known by itself.

original: de ltar kun byed pa'i tshig de ni chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar kun byed pa'i tshig de ni chos la chos kyi rjes su lta ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that statement “all” is called the application of mindfulness to phenomena that observes phenomena.

original: 'di ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi zad pa bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa mi zad pa bsgom pa ste /
translated: This is the meditation on the imperishable application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bsgom pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The explanation of the imperishable meditation on the four applications of mindfulness is complete.

original: // / brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / brtson 'grus thob pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu brtan pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / brtson 'grus thob pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu brtan pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate diligence as the antidote, diligence as purification, diligence as attainment, and diligence as firmness,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du @243a * //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi yang mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du @243a * //
translated: the text says, “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the four right efforts of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible.”

original: rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, too, the teaching and the explanation should be understood🔽in the same way as before.🔽What are the four?

original: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: This is the teaching.🔽The rest, up to

original: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //🔽de man chad lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo // de man chad lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: the right practice of the mind, is the explanation.

original: bzhi po de dag mi zad pa yang spang bar bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag mi zad pa yang spang bar bya ba dang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four are inexhaustible because the phenomena to be abandoned and to be accomplished are inexhaustible.

original: rgal ba sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba la ni yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bar 'os na /
analyzed: rgal ba sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa spong ba la ni yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bar 'os na /
translated: It is appropriate to call the abandonment of nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen and the abandonment of those that have arisen right abandonment.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes ba bskyed pa dang / skyes pa gnas par bya ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes ji ltar gdags she na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes ba bskyed pa dang / skyes pa gnas par bya ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes ji ltar gdags she na /
translated: But how can the generation of virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen and the maintenance of those that have arisen be called right abandonment?

original: de gnyis la gdags par mi rigs pa 'dra mod kyi /🔽dge ba bskyed pa dang gnas par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / bskyed cing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis la gdags par mi rigs pa 'dra mod kyi / dge ba bskyed pa dang gnas par bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs pa dang / bskyed cing gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: It is true that it is inappropriate to designate them as such.🔽However, there is no error in calling the abandonment of the counteragents of the generation and maintenance of those two right abandonment,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bas nyes pa med do//
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la yang dag pa'i spong ba zhes bya bas nyes pa med do//
translated: because they are generated and maintained by abandoning their counteragents.

original: brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus shin tu gnyen por gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva who is a very close antidote through effort?

original: gang yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po la zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po la zhugs pa ste /
translated: It is the one who has entered the first right abandonment.

original: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams kyi gnyen po bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: One cultivates the antidote to nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: “One generates will for the non-arising of any evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen. ” This is a synonym for proper mental attention.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed ces kyang bya /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed ces kyang bya /
translated: One generates will for the non-arising of evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byed ces kyang bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byed ces kyang bya ste /
translated: One properly attends to them.

original: 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba ni /
translated: One generates will.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: This is a synonym for proper mental attention.

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nyes par spyod pas yongs su bsdus pa dang / de skyed par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nyes par spyod pas yongs su bsdus pa dang / de skyed par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Here, evil, nonvirtuous dharmas are those which are included in the bad conduct of body, speech, and mind in the realm of desire, and the passions which generate them.

original: ma skyes pa na chos de mngon du ma gyur cing nye bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa na chos de mngon du ma gyur cing nye bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: When they have not yet arisen, those dharmas are not manifest and are not present.

original: mi skyed pa ni mngon du mi 'byung ba dang / nye bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi skyed pa ni mngon du mi 'byung ba dang / nye bar mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: One should not generate them, should not manifest them, and should not bring them into presence.

original: 'dun pa bskyed pa ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa la mi brten par mi @243b gtsang ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyi tshe sgom par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed pa ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa la mi brten par mi @243b gtsang ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po nyi tshe sgom par byed pa ste /
translated: The generation of will is the non-reliance on the mental attention to the signs of serenity, etc., which are the counteragents to that, and the cultivation of only the counteragents to impurity, etc.

original: de bas na 'dun pa bskyed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa bskyed pa ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Therefore, the generation of will is a synonym for proper mental attention.

original: 'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase one exerts effort with perseverance is a synonym for not abandoning proper mental attention.

original: 'dir yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: 'dir yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te / 'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes kyang bya /
translated: Here, one should also apply the phrase, “evil nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.”

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor mi gtong zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor mi gtong zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: “One exerts effort with perseverance” is also a synonym for “not abandoning proper mental attention.”

original: de bas na 'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dags so /
analyzed: de bas na 'bad pas brtson 'grus rtsom zhes bya ba ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba'i tshig bla dags so /
translated: Therefore, “one exerts effort with perseverance” is a synonym for “not abandoning proper mental attention.”

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skye'o //
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag kyang 'das pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa dang / da ltar gyi yul la dmigs nas skye'o //
translated: Moreover, those evil nonvirtuous dharmas arise by objectifying past things, by objectifying future things, and by objectifying present objects.

original: de ltar na de dag ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa dang / mngon sum du gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa dang / mngon sum du gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Thus, they objectify hidden objects and they objectify manifest objects.

original: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa ni lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the past and future is the hidden object.

original: da ltar gyi yul la dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi yul la dmigs pa ni mngon sum gyi yul la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The object of the present is the manifest object.

original: de la lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa ni 'bad do //
analyzed: de la lkog tu gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa ni 'bad do //
translated: With regard to that, one strives to prevent the arising of the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, whose object is the hidden.

original: mngon sum du gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur ba'i yul la dmigs pa'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ni brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One exerts effort to prevent the arising of the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, whose object is the manifest.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin du rtogs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces bya ba de ni tshul bzhin du rtogs pa'i tshig bla dags so zhes bya ba la ;
translated: “To hold the mind and to place it correctly” is a synonym for proper investigation.

original: 'dir yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dir yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: Here, too, one should add “the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.”

original: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces kyang bya /
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog ces kyang bya /
translated: “To hold the mind and to place it correctly” is a synonym for proper investigation.

original: tshul bzhin du rtogs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rtogs pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called “correct understanding.”

original: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni tshul bzhin du rtogs pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa ni tshul bzhin du rtogs pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Correctly apprehending and correctly setting the mind are synonyms for correct understanding.

original: de la sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhum pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs ba skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la sems rab tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhum pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs ba skyes par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Correctly apprehending the mind is when the secondary affliction of slackness arises,

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa sems gzung ba ste /🔽gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam @244a * //
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa sems gzung ba ste / gzung zhes bya ba ni de'i gnyen po 'phags pa'i lam @244a * //
translated: one should hold the mind by attending to faith and so on in order to eliminate it.

original: dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams bsams nas sems gzengs bstod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang ; de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams bsams nas sems gzengs bstod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Holding means that, having contemplated the ārya path and the qualities of the Tathāgata, one should uplift the mind.

original: yang dag par 'jog rab tu 'jog ces bya ba ni rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyes pa na sems nang du bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rtse gcig tu gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog rab tu 'jog ces bya ba ni rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa skyes pa na sems nang du bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rtse gcig tu gzhag pa ste /
translated: Correctly setting and correctly placing the mind is when the secondary affliction of agitation arises, one should place the mind one pointedly by the method of gathering the mind inward.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la yang dang yang du gzhag cing 'khor ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas skyo ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la yang dang yang du gzhag cing 'khor ba'i nyes pa la sogs pa yid la byed pas skyo ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: And one should generate weariness means that one should repeatedly focus on that very object, and generate weariness by attending to the faults of cyclic existence, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba ste /
translated: Why? is a question.

original: 'dun pa skyed pa dang / 'bad de brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa de dag la ci'i phyir tshul bzhin zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dun pa skyed pa dang / 'bad de brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sems rab tu 'dzin zhing yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa de dag la ci'i phyir tshul bzhin zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: Why are those who generate aspiration, who exert themselves in the practice of effort, who focus the mind, and who are correctly settled called 'properly applied'?

original: lan du tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The answer is: Proper application is... and so on.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gnyen po dang / zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa rnams ni de dang mi mthun pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi gnyen po dang / zhum pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa rnams ni de dang mi mthun pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug ste /
translated: The meditations that are the antidotes to sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas, and the antidotes to discouragement and agitation, do not engage in those sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas that are incompatible with them.

original: de bas na de dag ni tshul bzhin gyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni tshul bzhin gyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: Therefore, those are called 'proper application.'

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas there?

original: gang bslab pa gsum mthar dbyung bar bya ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: gang bslab pa gsum mthar dbyung bar bya ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: They are the phenomena that are incompatible with bringing the three trainings to completion.

original: de dag dngos po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag dngos po gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what those things are,

original: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he said, “the discordances with morality,” and so on.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims nyams pa nyid sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos so //🔽gang dag gzhan gyi tshul khrims kyang nyams par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa dang zhes bya ba ni gang yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims nyams pa nyid sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos so // gang dag gzhan gyi tshul khrims kyang nyams par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The degeneration of morality” is the degeneration of the morality of the six components.🔽“Those that cause the morality of others to degenerate” are the phenomena that are the causes of the degeneration of the morality of others.

original: gzhan dag tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i rgyu'i chos rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag tshul khrims nyams par byed pa'i rgyu'i chos rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Those are called “the phenomena that are nonvirtuous and evil.”

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyu bcu ste /
analyzed: rgyu bcu ste /
translated: They are the ten causes.

original: dang po nas legs par ma blangs pa dang / lhod par byed pa log par 'dzin pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / spyod lam nyams par gyur pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams par gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dang po nas legs par ma blangs pa dang / lhod par byed pa log par 'dzin pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / spyod lam nyams par gyur pa dang / 'tsho ba nyams par gyur ba dang /
translated: The first is not taking up the precepts well from the beginning; the second is laxity; the third is wrong grasping; the fourth is being overcome by heedlessness and laziness; the fifth is wrong aspiration; the sixth is faulty behavior; the seventh is faulty livelihood;

original: mtha' gnyis su ltung ba dang / 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / yi dam blangs pa nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su ltung ba dang / 'byung bar mi byed pa dang / yi dam blangs pa nyams pa'o //
translated: the eighth is falling into the two extremes; the ninth is not being active; and the tenth is letting the vow deteriorate.

original: de la ji ltar dang po nas legs par ma blangs she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar dang po nas legs par ma blangs she na /
translated: How is it that one does not take up the precepts well from the beginning?

original: 'di ltar rgyal po'i 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyal po'i 'jigs pas sam /
translated: It is like this: out of fear of the king,

original: rkun po'i 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: rkun po'i 'jigs pas sam /
translated: out of fear of thieves,

original: 'tsho ba med pa 'am /
analyzed: 'tsho ba med pa 'am /
translated: out of lack of livelihood,

original: de la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi @244b phyir blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i rkyen gzhan gyi @244b phyir blangs pa'o //
translated: and for other such reasons, one takes up the precepts.

original: ji ltar na lhod par byed pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lhod par byed pa zhe na /
translated: How is it that one is lax?

original: 'di la kha cig tshul khrims blangs nas kyang ngo tsha med pa dang / 'gyod pa chung ba dang / bslab pa'i gnas rnams la lhod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la kha cig tshul khrims blangs nas kyang ngo tsha med pa dang / 'gyod pa chung ba dang / bslab pa'i gnas rnams la lhod par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, some, even though they have taken up morality, are shameless, have little remorse, and are lax about the precepts.

original: ji ltar na log par 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par 'dzin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is wrong grasping?

original: kha cig log par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig log par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Some people are endowed with wrong grasping.🔽They are remorseful about what is not a matter for remorse.

original: gnas ma yin pa la 'gyod par gyur cing 'gyod pa des dge ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la 'gyod par gyur cing 'gyod pa des dge ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: This remorse is an obstacle to the wholesome.

original: ji ltar na bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is being seized by carelessness and laziness?

original: la la dag dang po nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar dam bca' ba med cing nyes pa byung nas yang slar chos bzhin gso bar mi byed la /
analyzed: la la dag dang po nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar dam bca' ba med cing nyes pa byung nas yang slar chos bzhin gso bar mi byed la /
translated: Some people do not make a vow not to commit faults from the beginning, and when they have committed faults, they do not restore them in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyal ba dang 'phres pa dang / gnyid kyi bde ba rnams lhur len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyal ba dang 'phres pa dang / gnyid kyi bde ba rnams lhur len par byed pa'o //
translated: They are devoted to the pleasures of sleep, lying on the right side, and drowsiness.

original: ji ltar na log par smon pa yin zhe na /🔽tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs sam /🔽dka' thub 'dis lha 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par smon pa yin zhe na / tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs sam / dka' thub 'dis lha 'am /
translated: What is wrong aspiration?🔽It is the aspiration for heaven or

original: lha gang yang rung ba 'am /
analyzed: lha gang yang rung ba 'am /
translated: for some other god through morality, asceticism,🔽or austerities,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan par gyur cig ces smos pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang ldan par gyur cig ces smos pa'o //
translated: or the aspiration for gain and honor.

original: ji ltar na spyod lam nyams par gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod lam nyams par gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is faulty behavior?

original: de la kha cig spyod lam dang / 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba la sbyor ba rnams 'jig rten dang mi mthun zhing 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi mthun zhing 'dul ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la kha cig spyod lam dang / 'phral gyi bya ba dang / dge ba la sbyor ba rnams 'jig rten dang mi mthun zhing 'jig rten dang 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang mi mthun zhing 'dul ba dang 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Some, in their behavior, in their immediate actions, and in their application to virtue, are contrary to the world and in conflict with the world, and are contrary to the discipline and in conflict with the discipline.

original: ji ltar 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'tsho ba nyams par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is there a degeneration of livelihood?

original: 'di la kha cig chog mi shes pa /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig chog mi shes pa /
translated: Some are discontented,

original: 'dod pa mang ba dang / gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa mang ba dang / gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba ste /
translated: having many desires, difficult to support, difficult to fill,

original: chos ma yin pa lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa lhung bzed dang chos gos la sogs pa tshol bar byed pa'o //
translated: and they seek alms bowls, robes, etc., which are not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na mtha' gnyis su lhung ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mtha' gnyis su lhung ba zhe na /
translated: How is there a falling into the two extremes?

original: 'di la kha cig 'dod pa'i bsod nams la lhag par zhen nas /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig 'dod pa'i bsod nams la lhag par zhen nas /
translated: Some, attached to the pleasures of desire,

original: 'dod pa'i chos rnams la bag med par spyod pa dang / la la dag tsher ma la gnas 'cha' ba dang / thal ba'i nang na gnas pa la sogs pa dka' thub mi bzad par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chos rnams la bag med par spyod pa dang / la la dag tsher ma la gnas 'cha' ba dang / thal ba'i nang na gnas pa la sogs pa dka' thub mi bzad par 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: indulge in the pleasures of desire without restraint, while others, like the Jains, take up unbearable austerities, such as living in thorns, in ashes, etc.

original: ji ltar na 'byung bar mi byed pa zhe na /🔽la la dag tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs sam lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'byung bar mi byed pa zhe na / la la dag tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs sam lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: How is it that they do not produce?🔽Some, through grasping at the supremacy of morality and asceticism,

original: tshul khrims 'di nyid dam /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'di nyid dam /
translated: or through grasping at the supremacy of views,

original: brtul zhugs 'di nyid kyis thar pa dang / grol bar 'gyur zhes lta ba'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs 'di nyid kyis thar pa dang / grol bar 'gyur zhes lta ba'o //
translated: think that through this morality or this asceticism, one will obtain liberation and release.

original: ji ltar na yi dam blangs pa nyams pa zhe na la la dag thams cad nas thams cad du ngo tsha med cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la mi 'dzem pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yi dam blangs pa nyams pa zhe na la la dag thams cad nas thams cad du ngo tsha med cing sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos byed pa la mi 'dzem pa /
translated: How is it that they violate their vows? Some, in every way, are shameless and have no fear of wrongdoing.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa tshig pa'i chos can khong du rul ba /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa tshig pa'i chos can khong du rul ba /
translated: They violate morality, are burned by their own faults, and are rotten within.

original: lung bong ltar kun du spyod pa /
analyzed: lung bong ltar kun du spyod pa /
translated: They behave like donkeys.

original: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dag go //
analyzed: dge sbyong ma yin par dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dag go //
translated: They are not ascetics, but claim to be ascetics.
Their ritual is ruined.

original: ga nyams zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ga nyams zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin nyams pa'o //
translated: Their ritual is ruined means their meditative concentration is ruined.

original: gang dag gzhan gyi sems kyang rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i chos ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed cing /
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyi sems kyang rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i chos ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag ting nge 'dzin las nyams par byed cing /
translated: Whatever things cause distraction in the minds of others are also called sinful, unwholesome things.

original: sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang rung ba rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems g-yeng bar 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang rung ba rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever things cause distraction in the minds of others, causing them to fall from concentration, are also called sinful, unwholesome things.

original: de yang chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa'i yo byad la chags pa mang ba dang / lus la nad mang ba dang / kha zas la mang du brkam pa dang / 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas par dga' ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bya ba mang po la dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de yang chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa'i yo byad la chags pa mang ba dang / lus la nad mang ba dang / kha zas la mang du brkam pa dang / 'du 'dzi mang po'i nang na gnas par dga' ba dang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bya ba mang po la dga' ba dang /
translated: Moreover, they are: having much attachment to requisites such as robes and bowls; having much illness in the body; having much craving for food; delighting in dwelling in the midst of much socializing; delighting in the many worldly activities of the world;

original: smra ba mang po la mos pa dang / nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o /
analyzed: smra ba mang po la mos pa dang / nyal ba dang 'phres pa la sogs pa la dga' ba'o /
translated: being devoted to much talk; delighting in sleeping, lying down, etc.

original: gang 'di ltar nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa 'am chad par lta bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'di ltar nyams pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa 'am chad par lta bar gyur ba'o //
translated: What is meant by falling in this way is falling into the views of eternalism or nihilism.

original: gang dag gzhan gyi lta ba yang nyams par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag log pa'i lta ba la zhen par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa mngon du 'byung ba dang / sgrib pa dang tshor bar 'gyur ba'i chos gong du bshad pa rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gzhan gyi lta ba yang nyams par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan dag log pa'i lta ba la zhen par 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa mngon du 'byung ba dang / sgrib pa dang tshor bar 'gyur ba'i chos gong du bshad pa rnams kyang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: Those which cause the degeneration of the views of others are called “evil, unwholesome dharmas.” The manifest afflictions, obscurations, and the previously explained dharmas that are the basis of feeling are also called “evil, unwholesome dharmas.”

original: brtson 'grus rab tu sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rab tu sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang zhe na /
translated: What is a bodhisattva who is skilled in effort?

original: gang yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i spong ba gnyis pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: He is one who has entered the second correct abandonment.

original: mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams shin tu sbyangs pa sgom par byed ba'o ;
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams shin tu sbyangs pa sgom par byed ba'o ;
translated: He cultivates the thorough purification of arisen evil, unwholesome dharmas.🔽With reference to him it is said:

original: / de'i dbang du byas nas gang yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / de'i dbang du byas nas gang yang sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Whatever evil, unwholesome dharmas have arisen…”

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gong du bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ni gong du bshad pa rnams so //
translated: Evil, unwholesome dharmas are as previously explained.

original: skyes pa ni mngon sum du gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni mngon sum du gyur ba'o //
translated: Arisen means manifest.

original: gong du bshad pa dang mthun pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad de /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa dang mthun pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad de /
translated: Those that are consistent with what was explained above are not explained here.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin du blta bar bya'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir /
translated: They should be viewed in accordance with what was explained earlier.🔽Why is that?

original: 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to generating aspiration and so on for the sake of abandoning arisen evil nonvirtuous dharmas,

original: ci'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: why is it called proper mental attention?🔽Those nonvirtuous dharmas do not exist in the mind as a mass.

original: mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la phung por gyur ba med ces bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag skyes ma thag tu 'gags te med par gyur bas sems la bcer zhing phung por gyur pa med de /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems la phung por gyur ba med ces bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag skyes ma thag tu 'gags te med par gyur bas sems la bcer zhing phung por gyur pa med de /
translated: Since those arisen evil nonvirtuous dharmas cease immediately upon arising and become nonexistent, they do not exist in the mind as a mass.

original: de bas na phyi nang gi yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing ming dang mtshan mar gdags par mi nus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na phyi nang gi yul dang phyogs na mi gnas shing ming dang mtshan mar gdags par mi nus zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they do not exist in inner and outer objects and directions, and they cannot be designated with names and signs.

original: gal te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dag med pa yin na /
translated: If those arisen evil nonvirtuous dharmas do not exist,

original: de @245b dag med pas spang ba'i rtsol ba mi dgos la /
analyzed: de @245b dag med pas spang ba'i rtsol ba mi dgos la /
translated: Since they do not exist, there is no need to strive to eliminate them.

original: spang ba zhes 'byung ba yang ji lta bu snyam pa la /
analyzed: spang ba zhes 'byung ba yang ji lta bu snyam pa la /
translated: And what is called “elimination”?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems las kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos de dag sems las kun du 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Those sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas arise from the mind, etc.”

original: sems las kun du 'byung ba ni chos de dag sems las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sems las kun du 'byung ba ni chos de dag sems las skyes pa'o //
translated: “Arise from the mind” means that those dharmas are born from the mind.

original: ji ltar spang bar shes pa ni spang bar shes pa'o ;
analyzed: ji ltar spang bar shes pa ni spang bar shes pa'o ;
translated: “Knowing how to eliminate” means knowing how to eliminate.

original: / ji ltar spang ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang dmigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'am /
analyzed: / ji ltar spang ba shes pa bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang dmigs pa gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rgyu ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'am /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said, “By what cause, by what object, etc.”

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags so //
translated: The cause is incorrect mental attention or the latent afflictions.

original: dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul rnams so //
translated: The object is the objects that give rise to the afflictions.

original: gang gis sdug pa'i rnam par 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang dmigs pa gang gis rgyu dang dmigs pa byas nas sdug par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i 'dod chags skye ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis sdug pa'i rnam par 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu dang dmigs pa gang gis rgyu dang dmigs pa byas nas sdug par 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'i 'dod chags skye ba 'am zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: By what? means By what cause and what object of the mental afflictions, having made a cause and an object, does the attachment that apprehends as pleasant arise? and so on.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i yul dang dmigs pa la'o //
translated: With regard to those means with regard to the objects and the objects of observation that give rise to the mental afflictions.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag yin no //
translated: These means the mental afflictions such as attachment.

original: tha snyad btags pa'i gzung gis zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pas 'dod chags zhi bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par na de la spang bar bya ba dang / spong bar byed pa gnyi ga med do chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mnyam par gnas shing /
analyzed: tha snyad btags pa'i gzung gis zhes bya ba ni mi sdug pas 'dod chags zhi bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ni tha snyad du btags pa tsam du zad kyi don dam par na de la spang bar bya ba dang / spong bar byed pa gnyi ga med do chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mnyam par gnas shing /
translated: The statement It is merely a conventional designation means that the statement Disgust pacifies attachment and so on is merely a conventional designation. In the ultimate, both the object of abandonment and the agent of abandonment do not exist. All phenomena are the same in emptiness.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du gyur pas na spang bar bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis mngon sum du gyur pas na spang bar bya ba med do //
translated: Since it is directly perceived by the wisdom of the āryas, there is nothing to be abandoned.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la snyegs te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la snyegs te /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyen pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that because the antidote eliminates the opposing factors.

original: brtson 'grus thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag par spong ba gsum pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag par spong ba gsum pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained effort has entered the third correct abandonment.

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams thob pa'i bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams thob pa'i bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: He cultivates the cultivation that is the attainment of virtuous dharmas that have not arisen.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gang dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gang dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With that in mind, it is said, “In order to generate virtuous dharmas that have not arisen,” and so on.

original: dge ba'i chos ni tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po ma skyes pa ni mngon du ma gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum po ma skyes pa ni mngon du ma gyur ba'o //
translated: Virtuous dharmas are the three trainings such as morality and so on. Those that have not arisen are those that have not become manifest.

original: bskyed pa'i phyir bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i phyir bya ba ni mngon du bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The action for generating them is for the sake of manifesting them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa la ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa bskyed pa la sogs pa la ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that one generates enthusiasm for generating wholesome states that have not yet arisen, and so on?

original: tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu bstan pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu bstan pa zhes bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is it called the expression of the immeasurables?

original: dge ba'i chos ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //🔽'dun @246a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so // 'dun @246a * //
translated: Wholesome states refers to the perfections such as generosity.

original: pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Enthusiasm is the root of all wholesome states.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i dge ba'i chos ni tshad med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sgrub pa'i dge ba'i chos ni tshad med de /
translated: The wholesome states that are accomplished by bodhisattvas are immeasurable.

original: de sgrub par 'dun pa yang tshad med pas de bas na /
analyzed: de sgrub par 'dun pa yang tshad med pas de bas na /
translated: Since the enthusiasm for accomplishing them is also immeasurable,

original: de ni tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni tshad med pa'i tshig shin tu brtan pa'o //
translated: it is the expression of the immeasurables.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgrub par 'dun pa las bsgrub pa 'byung zhing dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgrub par 'dun pa las bsgrub pa 'byung zhing dge ba'i chos skye bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since accomplishment arises from enthusiasm for accomplishing wholesome states and wholesome states come into being,

original: 'dun pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi rtsa ba zhes bya'o //
translated: enthusiasm is called the root of all wholesome states.

original: nyams su len par byed ces bya ba ni mthar phyin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su len par byed ces bya ba ni mthar phyin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “One practices” means “one perfects.”

original: dge ba'i chos de dag la spyod cing rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni smon lam gyi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dang de dag la so so'i mtshan nyid la rtog cing phyis kyang bskyed par bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos de dag la spyod cing rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni smon lam gyi dge ba'i chos skyes pa de dang de dag la so so'i mtshan nyid la rtog cing phyis kyang bskyed par bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: “One cultivates and analyzes those virtuous qualities” means that one contemplates the individual characteristics of those virtuous qualities of the aspiration that have arisen, and later generates them.

original: brtson 'grus rab tu brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rab tu brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhi pa la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is firmly engaged in effort is one who has entered the fourth perfect effort.

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams bstan pa'i bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams bstan pa'i bsgom par bya ba la sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: One cultivates the cultivation of the virtuous qualities that have arisen.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gang yang dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gang yang dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With reference to that, it is said: “One cultivates the virtuous qualities that have arisen.”

original: gnas pa ni sngar skyes pa rnams las de las chung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni sngar skyes pa rnams las de las chung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One does not diminish those that have arisen previously.

original: bsgom pa ni sngar skyes pa las shas chung zad skyed pa'i phyir de dag la yang nas yang du sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni sngar skyes pa las shas chung zad skyed pa'i phyir de dag la yang nas yang du sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the repeated cultivation of those roots of virtue that have already arisen in order to increase them slightly.

original: phyir zhing 'byung ba ni de bas kyang shas 'bring du bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chung du skyes pa la yang nas yang du sgom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhing 'byung ba ni de bas kyang shas 'bring du bskyed par bya ba'i phyir chung du skyes pa la yang nas yang du sgom par byed pa'o //
translated: Repeated cultivation is the repeated cultivation of those roots of virtue that have already arisen in order to increase them even more.

original: chud zab dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba don gcig ste skyes pa rnams nyams par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chud zab dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba don gcig ste skyes pa rnams nyams par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Non-loss and non-degeneration are synonymous.

original: yang na chud za bar mi 'gyur ba ni nyams par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chud za bar mi 'gyur ba ni nyams par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, non-loss is the non-degeneration of those that have arisen.

original: nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni brjed par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni brjed par mi bya ba'o //
translated: Non-degeneration is the non-forgetting of those that have arisen.

original: shin tu rgyas par bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mthar thug cing rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas par bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mthar thug cing rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Extensive development is the culmination and completion of all the roots of virtue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'dug pa la sogs par byed pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams 'dug pa la sogs par byed pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is it called the root of merit that is dedicated to enlightenment?

original: mthar thug gi bar du zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po ma thob kyi bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽chud mi za zhes bya ba ni med par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mthar thug gi bar du zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po ma thob kyi bar du zhes bya ba'i don to // chud mi za zhes bya ba ni med par mi 'gyur /
translated: Up to the end means up to the attainment of the essence of enlightenment.🔽It does not perish means it does not become nonexistent.

original: nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It does not deteriorate means it does not diminish.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rgya cher 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de /
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur zhing rgya cher 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de /
translated: It increases and expands is to be supplied.

original: byang chub kyi snying po'i @246b bar du mthar ma thug gi bar du bar ma dor ci'i phyir chud za zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po'i @246b bar du mthar ma thug gi bar du bar ma dor ci'i phyir chud za zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Why is that? means why does that root of merit dedicated to enlightenment not perish in the interval up to the essence of enlightenment?

original: khams gsum pa thams cad la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skyes pa'i rgyu mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad la mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du skyes pa'i rgyu mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not abide in any of the three realms means it does not act as the cause for birth in the three realms.

original: yongs su zad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du 'gyur ba'i chos de dag ni 'bras bu rnas par smin pa myong nas zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su zad par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du 'gyur ba'i chos de dag ni 'bras bu rnas par smin pa myong nas zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are completely exhausted means that those phenomena that occur in the three realms are exhausted after experiencing the ripening of their results.

original: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhin mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i spong ba bzhin mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The imperishability of the bases of supernatural power has already been explained as like the imperishability of the correct exertions.

original: // /'dun pa la shin tu gnas pa dang / brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa dang / sems la shin tu gnas pa dang / dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // /'dun pa la shin tu gnas pa dang / brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa dang / sems la shin tu gnas pa dang / dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the bases of supernatural power, the bases of success, and the bases of complete success,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: the sutra says, “Furthermore, Venerable Subhūti, the bases of supernatural power of the bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.

original: de mi zad pa yang 'dun par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang 'dun par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: ” Their imperishability is because the phenomena of aspiration and so on are inexhaustible.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul ni gong du mngon par shes pa lnga bstan pa 'am /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul ni gong du mngon par shes pa lnga bstan pa 'am /
translated: Supernatural power is as explained above in the five higher perceptions.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga'i nang na rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga'i nang na rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa bshad pa'o //
translated: Among the five superknowledges, the superknowledge of magical power is being discussed.

original: rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul de dag thob par byed pa'i rgyu 'am gzhi'o //
analyzed: rkang pa ni rdzu 'phrul de dag thob par byed pa'i rgyu 'am gzhi'o //
translated: The bases are the causes or foundations for attaining those magical powers.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood as fourfold:

original: rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gzhi dang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu dang / gzhi dang 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: classification, cause, foundation, and the accomplishment of the result.

original: de la 'di lta ste /🔽'dun pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la 'di lta ste / 'dun pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Regarding that, it is said:🔽Desire, thought, vigor, and investigation.

original: dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to //🔽de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten zhes bya ba nas las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to //🔽de sems las su rung ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni sems yang ba ma thob pa yan chad kyis gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rab tu dbye ba bstan to // de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten zhes bya ba nas las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad kyis rgyu bstan to // de sems las su rung ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni sems yang ba ma thob pa yan chad kyis gzhi bstan to //
translated: Up to here, the classification is explained.🔽The foundation of those up to one attains fitness of action explains the cause.🔽Having attained fitness of mind up to one attains lightness of body and mind explains the foundation.

original: de lus dang sems yang ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de lus dang sems yang ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That lightness of body and mind up to one attains the superknowledge of magical power explains the accomplishment of the result.

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “reaching the limits of space” and so forth indicates the accomplishment of the result.

original: de la 'dun pa ni gang gus par byed pa dang / dad pa la brten te sems rtse gcig pa la reg par byed pa'o //🔽brtson 'grus ni /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni gang gus par byed pa dang / dad pa la brten te sems rtse gcig pa la reg par byed pa'o // brtson 'grus ni /
translated: Among these, aspiration is that which, based on respect and faith, causes one to touch the one-pointed mind.

original: gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa la reg par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa la reg par byed pa'o //
translated: Exertion is that which, based on continuous practice, causes one to touch the one-pointed mind.

original: sems ni gang tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sems ni gang tshe rabs gzhan dang gzhan du ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas /
translated: The mind is that which, based on the cultivation of samādhi in other lifetimes,

original: tshe 'dir sems ni sngon gyi sems dang rjes su mthun par gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'dir sems ni sngon gyi sems dang rjes su mthun par gyur te /
translated: in this life the mind becomes in accord with the previous mind,

original: myur du sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: myur du sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa'o //
translated: and quickly touches the one-pointed mind.

original: dpyod pa ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos yod dam med ces rnam @247a * //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos yod dam med ces rnam @247a * //
translated: Analysis is that which, through the analysis of whether there are sinful, unwholesome dharmas in one’s mindstream,

original: par dpyod pa las sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: par dpyod pa las sems rtse gcig pa la reg par gyur pa'o //
translated: causes one to touch the one-pointed mind.

original: de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten dang gnas ni zhes bya ba la de dag ni 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi dag gam rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ste /🔽de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi 'am /
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa ba'i rten dang gnas ni zhes bya ba la de dag ni 'dun pa la sogs pa bzhi dag gam rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dag ste / de dag gi rtsa ba'i gzhi 'am /
translated: Their root support and basis is the four immeasurables.

original: rten du gyur pa ni tshad med pa bzhi dag go //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa ni tshad med pa bzhi dag go //
translated: The four immeasurables are the root support or basis of those four such as aspiration or the bases of supernatural powers.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sgra ni 'dun pa la sogs pa la snyegs te /🔽de dag ni rdzu 'phrul skye ba'i rtsa ba yin pas so //🔽'dun pa la sogs pa'i rten dang gnas ni tshad med pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sgra ni 'dun pa la sogs pa la snyegs te / de dag ni rdzu 'phrul skye ba'i rtsa ba yin pas so // 'dun pa la sogs pa'i rten dang gnas ni tshad med pa bzhi yin te /
translated: The term root refers to aspiration and so on because they are the root of supernatural power.

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bsgoms dgos pas so //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i sems kyis bsgoms dgos pas so //
translated: The four immeasurables are the support and basis of aspiration and so on because they must be cultivated with a mind possessing the four immeasurables.

original: tshad med pa bzhi ji ltar na rtsa ba'i rten dang gzhir 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi ji ltar na rtsa ba'i rten dang gzhir 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: How do the four immeasurables become the root support and basis?🔽The four immeasurables are the root support and basis of aspiration and so on because the four immeasurables are the root of aspiration and so on.

original: de tshad med pa bzhi po 'di dag la brten cing bsgoms te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de tshad med pa bzhi po 'di dag la brten cing bsgoms te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The four immeasurables are the root support and basis of aspiration and so on because they must be cultivated with a mind possessing the four immeasurables.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la bsgom par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la bsgom par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des so //
translated: “That” refers to the bodhisattva who wishes to cultivate the four bases of supernatural powers.🔽

original: bstan pa ni dang po nyid du tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni dang po nyid du tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa la brten pa'o //
translated: The one who is called a bodhisattva who wishes to cultivate the bases of supernatural power should cultivate the four immeasurables first of all.

original: bsgom pa ni de'i 'og tu yang nas yang du mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni de'i 'og tu yang nas yang du mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the repeated actualization of them after that.

original: mang du byas pa ni tshad med pa bzhi mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: mang du byas pa ni tshad med pa bzhi mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa rgyun mi gcod pa'o //
translated: Great cultivation is the uninterrupted cultivation of them in order to perfect the four immeasurables.

original: sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig tu gnas su btub ba thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sems rtse gcig tu gnas su btub ba thob bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He attains fitness of mind, i.e., he attains the ability to place his mind onepointedly.

original: bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par gzhog pa la sogs pa smos pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la mnyam par gzhog pa la sogs pa smos pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas rdzu 'phrul bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the attainment of the first meditative absorption, etc., is because the supernatural powers are generated in dependence on the fourth meditative absorption.

original: lus dang sems yang ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lus yang ba thob ba ni /
analyzed: lus dang sems yang ba thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lus yang ba thob ba ni /
translated: He attains lightness of body and mind.

original: rang gi don sgrub pa la myur du 'jug tu btub cing gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa med pa thob pa'o//
analyzed: rang gi don sgrub pa la myur du 'jug tu btub cing gnyid dang rmugs pa la sogs pa med pa thob pa'o//
translated: It is the attainment of the ability to quickly engage in accomplishing one's own aim, and the absence of sleepiness, drowsiness, etc.

original: sems yang pa ni de bzhin du rang gi bya ba myur du 'jug tu btub pa'o //
analyzed: sems yang pa ni de bzhin du rang gi bya ba myur du 'jug tu btub pa'o //
translated: Lightness of mind is the ability to quickly engage in one's own actions in the same way.

original: mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa la mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la 'jug pa la mngon par sgrub po zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The phrase one accomplishes the attainment of supernormal knowledge means that one accomplishes the attainment of the supernormal knowledge of supernormal power.

original: 'dun pa las sam brtson 'grus las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bsgrub pa dang ldan pa de ni 'dun pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa las sam brtson 'grus las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar bsgrub pa dang ldan pa de ni 'dun pa la sogs pa gang yang rung ba la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The phrase from desire, from effort, etc., means that one who possesses such accomplishment generates the bases of supernormal power in dependence on any one of desire, etc.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rdzu 'phrul nyid la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rdzu 'phrul nyid la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: The term bases of supernormal power is here held to refer to supernormal power itself.

original: yang na 'dun pa las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos de bzhis de dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas thob par byed pa'i don @247b to ;
analyzed: yang na 'dun pa las sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos de bzhis de dag gi 'bras bu'i gnas thob par byed pa'i don @247b to ;
translated: Or else, “from aspiration” and so on means that by these four dharmas one attains the state of the result.

original: / rkang pa ni 'dir 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas lta bu la bya'o //
analyzed: / rkang pa ni 'dir 'bras bu thob pa'i gnas lta bu la bya'o //
translated: Here, the “state” is like the state of attaining the result.

original: de la gang 'dun pa la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang bo la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang 'dun pa la rab tu gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang bo la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva who is well-established in aspiration is one who has entered the first basis of miraculous powers.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la 'dun pa ni gang chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la 'dun pa ni gang chos de dag la mngon du phyogs pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: With reference to him, it is said, “Aspiration is the orientation toward those dharmas.”

original: chos zhes bya bas 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin tam /
analyzed: chos zhes bya bas 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin tam /
translated: “Dharmas” refers to the meditative concentration of aspiration,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la bya ste /
translated: or to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: 'dun pa ni chos de rnams la phyogs shing mos pa dang dad pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni chos de rnams la phyogs shing mos pa dang dad pa byed pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the orientation toward and the faith in those dharmas.

original: brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba gnyis la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la shin tu gnas pa ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba gnyis la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Well-established in effort is one who has entered the second basis of miraculous powers.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: brtson 'grus ni gang chos de dag sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni gang chos de dag sgrub pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: and effort is the practice of those dharmas.

original: chos de dag sgrub pa ni tshad med pa dang bsam gtan dang rdzu 'phrul gyi chos rnams sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: chos de dag sgrub pa ni tshad med pa dang bsam gtan dang rdzu 'phrul gyi chos rnams sgrub ba'o //
translated: The practice of those dharmas is the practice of the dharmas of the immeasurables, the dhyanas, and the superknowledges.

original: sems la shin tu gnas pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gsum la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: sems la shin tu gnas pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa gsum la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Firmness in mind is the entry into the three bases of psychic power.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas sems ni gang chos de dag la rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so //🔽chos de dag la rtog pa ni gang du bshad pa'i chos rnams la yin nam /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas sems ni gang chos de dag la rtog pa'o zhes gsungs so // chos de dag la rtog pa ni gang du bshad pa'i chos rnams la yin nam /
translated: With reference to that, it is said: “Mind is the investigation of those dharmas. ”

original: ma yin zhes 'jog pa'am /
analyzed: ma yin zhes 'jog pa'am /
translated: The investigation of those dharmas is the establishment of the dharmas that have been explained as either existent or nonexistent.

original: rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: Or it is the single-pointed establishment of those dharmas.

original: dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa la shin tu gnas pa ni gang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Firmness in analysis is the entry into the four bases of psychic power.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas dpyod pa ni gang chos de dag la mkhas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas dpyod pa ni gang chos de dag la mkhas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, it is said: “Analysis is the skill in those dharmas. ”

original: dpyod na shes rab ste /
analyzed: dpyod na shes rab ste /
translated: Analysis is wisdom.

original: de ni gong du bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gong du bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is the expertise in the characteristics of the phenomena explained above.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin bzhi bsgom pa la spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽'dun pa ni nam zhig na bdag gi ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs shing /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin bzhi bsgom pa la spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur te / 'dun pa ni nam zhig na bdag gi ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs shing /
translated: Thus, the eight formative factors of abandonment occur in the cultivation of the four meditative concentrations.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur zhig gru snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi bag la nyal spong bar 'gyur zhig gru snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the thought: “When will I perfect meditative concentration and abandon the latent states of sinful, non-virtuous dharmas?”

original: rtsol ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa la sbyor ba mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba ni gnyen po bsgom pa la sbyor ba mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Exertion is the non-abandonment of the application to the cultivation of the antidote.

original: dad pa ni sbyor ba ma btang ba'i gong du rtogs par bya ba la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni sbyor ba ma btang ba'i gong du rtogs par bya ba la yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is the conviction in the realization prior to the non-abandonment of application.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni dad pa sngon du btang ba'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni dad pa sngon du btang ba'i dga' ba ste /
translated: Pliability is the joy preceded by faith,

original: yid dga' bar gyur pa'i rim gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnas ngan len sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: yid dga' bar gyur pa'i rim gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnas ngan len sbyangs pa'o //
translated: the gradual purification of the negative tendencies of sinful, non-virtuous dharmas through the process of mental joy.

original: dran pa ni zhi gnas kyi sems zin pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni zhi gnas kyi sems zin pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the retention of the mind of śamatha.

original: shes bzhin ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: Awareness is vipaśyanā.

original: sems pa ni spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa la spyod pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi lus kun nas slong @248a * //
analyzed: sems pa ni spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa la spyod pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / mthun pa'i lus dang ngag gi lus kun nas slong @248a * //
translated: The mind is the basis of the wholesome roots, the basis of the unwholesome roots, the basis of the wholesome and unwholesome roots, the basis of the abandonment of the wholesome and unwholesome roots, the basis of the practice of the wholesome roots, the basis of the practice of the unwholesome roots, the basis of the practice of the wholesome and unwholesome roots, the basis of the abandonment of the practice of the wholesome and unwholesome roots, the basis of calm abiding and insight, the basis of the body and speech that are in harmony with them, and the basis of the abandonment of the body and speech that are in harmony with them.

original: ba'o ; / btang snyoms ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang mthun pa dag la spyod pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ba'o ; / btang snyoms ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang mthun pa dag la spyod pa'i sems kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing mnyam pa nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the absence of mental afflictions and the state of balance in relation to the practice of the wholesome roots and the unwholesome roots that are in harmony with them.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par sgrub pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par sgrub pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard, the phrase “by means of the accomplishment of the bases of supernatural power” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la 'dun pa la sogs ba rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgrub pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la 'dun pa la sogs ba rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa sgrub pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
translated: that the bodhisattva accomplishes supernatural power by means of the bases of supernatural power, which are will, etc.

original: de bas na 'dun pa la sogs pa la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa la sogs pa la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, will, etc., are called the bases of supernatural power.

original: de la 'dun pa dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa dang rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul sgrub pa'o //
translated: Among them, will and the base of supernatural power are the means by which supernatural power is accomplished.

original: brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul mthar 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul mthar 'byin par byed do //
translated: The foot of miraculous power of effort brings the miracles to completion.

original: / sems rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni mthar dbyung ba'i rdzu 'phrul rnams mi nyams par byed do //
analyzed: / sems rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni mthar dbyung ba'i rdzu 'phrul rnams mi nyams par byed do //
translated: The foot of miraculous power of mind prevents the miracles that have been brought to completion from declining.

original: dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul de dag gtan la 'bebs shing gang dang gang bya ba mngon bar byed pa'o //🔽mos pa las byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba las dang po pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnams ni de kho na ma rtogs pas dngos po 'di ltar gyur cig ces /
analyzed: dpyod pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pas ni rdzu 'phrul de dag gtan la 'bebs shing gang dang gang bya ba mngon bar byed pa'o // mos pa las byung ba mngon par 'du byed pa med pa zhes bya ba las dang po pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnams ni de kho na ma rtogs pas dngos po 'di ltar gyur cig ces /
translated: The foot of miraculous power of investigation brings about the miracles that have been completed and determines what should be done.🔽The miracles of the beginner bodhisattva who has not realized reality are called “arisen from aspiration” and “unfabricated.”🔽They arise from the effort of generating the aspiration in the mind that “this thing be thus,” with regard to what has not been actualized.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la sems kyis mos pa bskyed nas brtsal ba las 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' yongs su sbyang ba byas pa rnams gdod smon cing 'bad pa dang brtsal mi dgos par bsams pa tsam gyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rdzu
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la sems kyis mos pa bskyed nas brtsal ba las 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' yongs su sbyang ba byas pa rnams gdod smon cing 'bad pa dang brtsal mi dgos par bsams pa tsam gyis lhun gyis grub pa nyid du rdzu
translated: But for the bodhisattvas who have completed the training, the miracles arise effortlessly, spontaneously, merely through the wish.

original: 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The bases of psychic power are perfected.

original: de bas na rang gi sems pa skyed pas dbang byed pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi sems pa skyed pas dbang byed pa ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “One has power over one’s own mind, and goes as one wishes.”

original: ting nge 'dzin mnyam par gzhag pa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par dngos po 'di 'di ltar bya'o snyam du rang gi sems bskyed pa tsam gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnyam par gzhag pa la sogs pa rgyu rkyen gzhan la mi ltos par dngos po 'di 'di ltar bya'o snyam du rang gi sems bskyed pa tsam gyis ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Without depending on other causes and conditions, such as meditative concentration, by merely generating one’s own mind, thinking, “This thing should be done in this way,” one has power over it as one wishes.

original: yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pas ni mthar phyung zhing las su rung bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba legs par byas pas ni mthar phyung zhing las su rung bar byas pa'o //
translated: Having well-purified the bases of psychic power, one has perfected and made them serviceable.

original: rtsa ba la shin tu gnas pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: rtsa ba la shin tu gnas pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: “Well-established in the root” means established in the root of faith, etc.,

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i tshad med pa bzhi'i rtsa ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i tshad med pa bzhi'i rtsa ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: or established in the root of the four immeasurables, such as love.

original: thams cad du rgyu ba ni kun du khyab par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu ba ni kun du khyab par byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Moving everywhere” means pervading and going to all buddha-fields.

original: rlung dmar bzhin du thogs pa med pa ni rlung dmar dang 'dra bar thags thogs med par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dmar bzhin du thogs pa med pa ni rlung dmar dang 'dra bar thags thogs med par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Like a hurricane, it is unstoppable, like a hurricane, it goes without obstruction.

original: nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mthar thug pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du yang nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: It reaches the end of space, like space, it does not decline until the end of time.

original: rdzu 'phrul @248b gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul @248b gyi rkang pa bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: Thus has been explained the imperishability of the four bases of magic power.

original: // / dad pa'i mchog dang brtson 'grus kyi mchog dang / dran pa'i mchog dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog dang / shes rab kyi mchog bstan pa'i phyir /
