analyzed: // / dad pa'i mchog dang brtson 'grus kyi mchog dang / dran pa'i mchog dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog dang / shes rab kyi mchog bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the supremacy of faith, the supremacy of vigor, the supremacy of mindfulness, the supremacy of concentration, and the supremacy of wisdom,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu /
translated: the Lord said,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po lnga mi zad ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de dag mi zad pa yang dad par bya ba chos dang dngos po mi zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po lnga mi zad ba ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de dag mi zad pa yang dad par bya ba chos dang dngos po mi zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Sariputra, the five faculties of the bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.🔽And their imperishability is due to the imperishability of the objects of faith and so on.

original: de la dad par byed pa la sogs pa yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dad par byed pa la sogs pa yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: And the faith and so on that have those as objects are also imperishable.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /🔽de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste / de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, it should be understood in the manner of teaching and explanation.

original: shes rab kyi dbang bo zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang bo zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Among them, beginning with What is the faculty of faith? up to What is the faculty of wisdom? is the manner of teaching.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The rest is the manner of explanation.

original: dad pa mchog gi byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa'i dbang po la yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa mchog gi byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa'i dbang po la yang dag par zhugs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is supreme in faith is one who has truly entered the faculty of faith.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dad pa'i nang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dad pa mchog dam pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dad pa'i nang na 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dad pa mchog dam pa /
translated: Among worldly faiths, supramundane faith is supreme,

original: khyad zhugs pa /🔽bla mar gyur pa /
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa / bla mar gyur pa /
translated: distinguished,🔽superior,

original: bla na med pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: and unsurpassed.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With that as the basis, it is said, What is the faculty of faith? and so on.

original: dad pa'i mchog la ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi mchog gi bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad pa'i mchog la ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi mchog gi bar du sbyar ro //
translated: Just as with supreme faith, it should be applied up to supreme wisdom.

original: dad pa nyid dbang po yin pas na dad pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: dad pa nyid dbang po yin pas na dad pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: Faith itself is a faculty, so it is the faculty of faith.

original: dbang po'i don ni phyis bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po'i don ni phyis bshad do //
translated: The objects of the faculties will be explained later.

original: dad pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni dmigs par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni dmigs par gyur pa ste /
translated: By which faith is meant that which is the object of faith.

original: sems dang ba dang / yid ches par gyur pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems dang ba dang / yid ches par gyur pa gang gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means by which the mind is purified and becomes confident.

original: chos bzhi la 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba la bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi la 'dod pa ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba la bya ste /
translated: The four dharmas are the objects of faith.

original: de dag la de bzhin du yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la de bzhin du yid ches pa'o //
translated: It is confidence in them.

original: 'di lta ste 'khor ba nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'khor ba nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with “in cyclic existence,”

original: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa mi byed pa yan chad chos gcig go //
analyzed: srog gi phyir yang sdig pa mi byed pa yan chad chos gcig go //
translated: up to “not committing evil even for the sake of one’s life” is one dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pas te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pas te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Faith in the bodhisattva deeds, up to

original: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi skyed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du chos gnyis so //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi skyed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du chos gnyis so //
translated: “not generating desire for other vehicles” is the second dharma.

original: chos thams cad la don dam par zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la don dam par zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In all dharmas ultimately, up to

original: bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba yan chad chos gsum mo //
analyzed: bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba yan chad chos gsum mo //
translated: “not harboring latent tendencies” is the third dharma.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Powers, fearlessnesses, and so on, up to🔽“not being satisfied with just a little” is the fourth dharma.

original: chos de dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad chos bzhi'o //🔽'khor ba na yod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin @249a * //
analyzed: chos de dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba yan chad chos bzhi'o // 'khor ba na yod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa ma yin @249a * //
translated: The four dharmas beginning with “the correct practice of those dharmas” are the four right efforts.

original: pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod pa las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa yod par lta ba la /
analyzed: pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi spyod pa las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog la sogs pa yod par lta ba la /
translated: “Faith in the mundane correct view that exists in saṃsāra” is the view of the existence of the actions and results of the conduct of ordinary beings who are not āryas, and of the Three Jewels, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: That is called “mundane correct view.”

original: yod par lta ba de la dad pa'o //
analyzed: yod par lta ba de la dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in that view of existence is faith in the mundane correct view.

original: de bas na de las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na de las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “He is one who relies on the ripening of karma,” and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: “He” refers to the bodhisattva who has faith in the mundane correct view.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pa ni las kyi rnam par smin pa yod par lta ba'o //
translated: “Relying on the ripening of karma” is viewing the existence of the ripening of karma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / de dag gi yon tan la dad cing yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa ste zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos dang / de dag gi yon tan la dad cing yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith in the bodhisattva activities is faith in the qualities of the levels and transcendent perfections and in the qualities of those who practice them.

original: spyod pa de la zhugs pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa de la zhugs pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Engaged in those activities means engaged in the activities of the levels and transcendent perfections.

original: nas kyang zhes bya ba ni zhugs phan chad do //
analyzed: nas kyang zhes bya ba ni zhugs phan chad do //
translated: And means after having become engaged.

original: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi skyed pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi skyed pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa la mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Not wishing for other vehicles means not practicing the vehicles of the listeners and so on.

original: chos thams cad la don dam pa zhes bya ba ni dad do zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
analyzed: chos thams cad la don dam pa zhes bya ba ni dad do zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
translated: Faith in the ultimate of all phenomena is to be connected with the phrase “is faith in.

original: chos thams cad nyid don dam par nges pa'i don zab mo rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa la sogs par dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nyid don dam par nges pa'i don zab mo rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa la sogs par dad pa'o //
translated: ” It is faith in the fact that all phenomena are the ultimate, the profound definitive meaning, dependent arising and so on.

original: don dam par ni stong pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni stong pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, they are empty.

original: nges pa'i don zab mo ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gzhan gyis khong du chud par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zab mo ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gzhan gyis khong du chud par dka' ba'o //
translated: The profound definitive meaning is the unmistaken meaning that is difficult for others to understand.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu rkyen las 'byung bas ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rgyu rkyen las 'byung bas ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Dependent origination is not produced because it arises from causes and conditions.

original: dad pa ni de bzhin du yin par yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni de bzhin du yin par yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is confidence in the way things are.

original: lta bar gyur pa thams cad la bag la nyal bar mi byed pa ni lta ba phyin ci log rnams kyi bag chags stsogs par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa thams cad la bag la nyal bar mi byed pa ni lta ba phyin ci log rnams kyi bag chags stsogs par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not forming latent tendencies for all views is not forming latent tendencies for mistaken views.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la yod par yid ches shing dad pa'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa la dad pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la yod par yid ches shing dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on is confidence and faith in the qualities of the Tathagata.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nyid la snyegs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa nyid la snyegs pa'o //
translated: Those refers to the powers, fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mchog gi byang chub sems dpa' ni gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pas te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mchog gi byang chub sems dpa' ni gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pas te /
translated: The bodhisattva of supreme diligence is one who has entered the faculty of diligence.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With him as the focus,

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs so //
translated: it is said, What is the faculty of diligence? and so on.

original: dad par gyur pa na yod par yid ches par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dad par gyur pa na yod par yid ches par gyur pa'o //
translated: When there is faith, there is confidence in existence.

original: dran pa'i mchog ni gang dran pa'i dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa'i mchog ni gang dran pa'i dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The supreme of mindfulness is that which is engaged in the faculty of mindfulness.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: de la dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said: “What is the faculty of mindfulness?”

original: chud mi gson pa nyid ni nyams par mi byed cing @249b brjed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: chud mi gson pa nyid ni nyams par mi byed cing @249b brjed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Non-loss is not to be lost and not to forget.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mchog ni /
translated: The supreme of samādhi is

original: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: that which is engaged in the faculty of samādhi.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, it is said: “What is the faculty of samādhi?”

original: rtse gcig tu byed pas ni rtse gcig tu dmigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu byed pas ni rtse gcig tu dmigs par byed pa'o //
translated: One-pointedly is to focus one-pointedly.

original: shes rab kyi mchog ni gang shes rab kyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mchog ni gang shes rab kyi dbang po la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The supreme of wisdom is that which is engaged in the faculty of wisdom.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, it is said: “What is the faculty of wisdom?”

original: rab tu rtogs pa ni chos de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la rab tu 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa ni chos de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid la rab tu 'byed pa'o //
translated: Thorough understanding is the thorough analysis of the intrinsic identity of those teachings.

original: shin tu rtogs pa ni chos de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o ;
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa ni chos de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o ;
translated: Complete understanding is the comprehension of the general identity of those teachings.

original: / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la brten mi dgos par shes pa'o //
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la brten mi dgos par shes pa'o //
translated: Not being led by others is the knowledge that does not need to rely on the teachings of others.

original: so so rang gis shes pa ni chos de dag rang nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis shes pa ni chos de dag rang nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: Self-cognizance is the direct experience of those teachings by oneself.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: Thus is the explanation above.

original: lhan cig 'grogs shing rjes su 'brel pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po de lnga po gcig gi grogs gcig gis byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'grogs shing rjes su 'brel pa ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po de lnga po gcig gi grogs gcig gis byas nas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Accompanying and following is the completion of all the Buddha qualities by the five faculties of faith, etc. , each one acting as the companion of the other.

original: lung bstan pa'i sar yang gzhog go zhes bya ba ni de rnams dang ldan na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lung bstan du mngon zhing /
analyzed: lung bstan pa'i sar yang gzhog go zhes bya ba ni de rnams dang ldan na bla na med pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lung bstan du mngon zhing /
translated: If they possess these, they are predicted to fully awaken to supreme enlightenment, and they are worthy of prediction.

original: lung bstan par 'os par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung bstan par 'os par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par byed pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs par byed pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supramundane faculties are so called because they are the faculties that realize supramundane dharmas.

original: de la dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don te /
analyzed: de la dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don te /
translated: The meaning of faculty is the meaning of mastery.

original: dad pa'i dbang bos ni dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug par bya ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang bos ni dge ba'i chos rnams la 'jug par bya ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of faith is the mastery in engaging in virtuous dharmas.

original: de'i dbang gis dge pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis dge pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one engages in virtuous dharmas by the power of that.

original: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni dge ba'i chos rnams skyed pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos ni dge ba'i chos rnams skyed pa la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of effort is the mastery in generating virtuous dharmas.

original: de'i mthus dge ba'i chos rnams skyed par byed pas so //
analyzed: de'i mthus dge ba'i chos rnams skyed par byed pas so //
translated: Because one generates virtuous dharmas by the power of that.

original: dran pa'i dbang pos ni dge ba'i chos rnams chud mi za ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: dran pa'i dbang pos ni dge ba'i chos rnams chud mi za ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of mindfulness controls the non-loss of wholesome dharmas.

original: des mi brjed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mi brjed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes non-forgetting.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos ni gzhan du mi g-yeng ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos ni gzhan du mi g-yeng ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of meditative concentration controls non-distraction.

original: des dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu 'jog pas so //
analyzed: des dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu 'jog pas so //
translated: Because it causes the one-pointedness of the mind on the object of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi dbang pos ni mthar 'byin pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang pos ni mthar 'byin pa la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of wisdom controls the final accomplishment.

original: des dge ba'i chos thams cad mthar 'byin par byed pas so //🔽dbang @250a * //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos thams cad mthar 'byin par byed pas so // dbang @250a * //
translated: Because it causes the final accomplishment of all wholesome dharmas.

original: po lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: po lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The five faculties have been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / dad pa mi tshugs pa dang / brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa dang / dran pa mi tshugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa dang / shes rab mi tshugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / dad pa mi tshugs pa dang / brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa dang / dran pa mi tshugs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa dang / shes rab mi tshugs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inexhaustible faith, inexhaustible vigor, inexhaustible mindfulness, inexhaustible meditative concentration, and inexhaustible wisdom,🔽it is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs lnga mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs lnga mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the five powers of the bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs lnga mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste / de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs lnga mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, it should be understood in terms of teaching and explanation.

original: shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo /
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo /
translated: The teaching is from the beginning of the chapter up to the power of wisdom.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //🔽dad pa la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams la stobs zhes bya ba yang dbang po'i tshe na ni dad par bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams mngon du bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa la dbang byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo // dad pa la sogs pa lnga po 'di rnams la stobs zhes bya ba yang dbang po'i tshe na ni dad par bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams mngon du bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa la dbang byed pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The explanation is the rest of the chapter.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi tshugs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi tshugs pa ma yin no //
translated: These five, faith and so on, are called powers because at the stage of the faculties they are simply the controlling factors for manifesting and accomplishing the qualities of faith and so on, but they are not yet able to crush the opposing factors.

original: stobs kyi dus na ni dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid rab tu bsgoms shing sbyangs te mthu dang ldan par gyur pas /
analyzed: stobs kyi dus na ni dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid rab tu bsgoms shing sbyangs te mthu dang ldan par gyur pas /
translated: But at the stage of the powers, faith and so on are fully cultivated and trained and so become powerful.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi tshugs pa la stobs zhes bya'o //🔽de mi zad pa yang de dag gis dad par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas de la dad par byed pa mi zad pa'am /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis mi tshugs pa la stobs zhes bya'o // de mi zad pa yang de dag gis dad par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas de la dad par byed pa mi zad pa'am /
translated: The strength of the faith that cannot be overcome by adverse factors such as lack of faith, etc. is called strength.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pas med par bya zhing zad par bya bar mi nus pas na mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pas med par bya zhing zad par bya bar mi nus pas na mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because the faith that is produced in it is inexhaustible due to the inexhaustibility of the teachings that are to be believed in, or because it cannot be destroyed or exhausted by lack of faith, etc.

original: dad pa mi tshugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa'i stobs shin tu bsgoms shing /
analyzed: dad pa mi tshugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dad pa'i stobs shin tu bsgoms shing /
translated: The bodhisattva who has faith that cannot be overcome has well cultivated the strength of faith,

original: ma dad pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: ma dad pa dang ma 'dres pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: and is one whose qualities are not mixed with lack of faith, etc.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la dad pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dad pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the strength of faith? etc.

original: dad pa mi tshugs pa la ji lta ba bzhin shes rab mi tshugs pa'i bar du yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dad pa mi tshugs pa la ji lta ba bzhin shes rab mi tshugs pa'i bar du yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied up to the wisdom that cannot be overcome, just as with the faith that cannot be overcome.

original: mos pa ni gang sgrub pa dang bya ba'i chos rnams bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni gang sgrub pa dang bya ba'i chos rnams bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to accomplish and practice the teachings that are to be accomplished and practiced.

original: dad pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la sems dang zhing yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni bden pa dang dkon mchog la sems dang zhing yid ches pa'o //
translated: Faith is the clarity and confidence of mind with regard to the Truths and the Three Jewels.

original: mi brdzi ba ni gzhan gyis mi zlogs shing mi tshugs pa dang / de'i dad pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni gzhan gyis mi zlogs shing mi tshugs pa dang / de'i dad pa'i stobs so //
translated: Invincibility is the state of being unassailable by others, and the strength of one's faith.

original: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify the meaning of that, he says:

original: gal te bdud sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te bdud sdig can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: If Mara, the Evil One, in the guise of a Buddha, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bsgyur te zhes bya ba'i don @250b to ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gzugs kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su bsgyur te zhes bya ba'i don @250b to ;
translated: In the guise of a Buddha means having transformed himself into the form of a Tathagata.

original: / chos la nges par sems pa'i mos pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang la sems pa'i mos pa dang dad pa'o //
analyzed: / chos la nges par sems pa'i mos pa zhes bya ba ni chos gang la sems pa'i mos pa dang dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in the certainty of the Dharma is the faith and confidence in the Dharma which is to be contemplated.

original: 'bral bar byed ces bya ba ni gtong du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'bral bar byed ces bya ba ni gtong du 'jug pa'o //
translated: To separate means to cause to abandon.

original: 'dun pa zlog ces bya ba ni thabs sna tshogs kyis lta ba gzhan la 'jud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa zlog ces bya ba ni thabs sna tshogs kyis lta ba gzhan la 'jud par byed pa'o //
translated: To turn away from aspiration means to cause to enter into another view by various means.

original: bskyod pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mos pa las bzlog bar mi nus pa'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bskyod pa la sogs pa'i tshig ni mos pa las bzlog bar mi nus pa'i rnam grangs so //
translated: To shake and so on are synonyms for to be unable to turn away from faith.

original: yang na nyan pa'i dus na mos pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bskyod par mi nus pa'o //🔽sems pa'i dus na dad pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bsgul bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa'i dus na mos pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bskyod par mi nus pa'o // sems pa'i dus na dad pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bsgul bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: Again, at the time of listening, faith cannot be turned away, which is “cannot be shaken.”🔽At the time of reflection, faith cannot be turned away, which is “cannot be moved.”

original: bsgom pa'i dus na dad pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bslang bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dus na dad pa bzlog par mi nus pa ni bslang bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: At the time of cultivation, faith cannot be turned away, which is “cannot be lifted up.”

original: brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang brtson 'grus kyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi tshugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang brtson 'grus kyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is unassailable by effort is one who has entered the power of effort.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la brtson 'grus kyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus kyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “What is the power of effort?” and so on.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa gang dang gang rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brgyad po sngar bstan pa gang dang gang gis dge ba gang la rtsom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa gang dang gang rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brgyad po sngar bstan pa gang dang gang gis dge ba gang la rtsom pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Whatever effort one undertakes” means whatever of the eight kinds of effort previously taught one undertakes, one undertakes whatever virtue.

original: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos gang dang gang byed pa ste //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos gang dang gang la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos gang dang gang byed pa ste //
translated: “Whatever virtuous activities” means whatever virtuous activities such as generosity.

original: rtsom ba ni dang po nyid du dge ba'i chos rtsom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom ba ni dang po nyid du dge ba'i chos rtsom par byed pa'o //
translated: “Undertaking” means first undertaking virtuous activities.

original: sbyor ba ni de phan chad rgyun du sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de phan chad rgyun du sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: “Application” means subsequently practicing them continuously.

original: de dang de la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos brtsams shing sbyar ba de dang de la'o //
analyzed: de dang de la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos brtsams shing sbyar ba de dang de la'o //
translated: “In this and that” means in this and that virtuous activity that has been undertaken and applied.

original: stobs skyed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mthu skyed pa'o //
analyzed: stobs skyed pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mthu skyed pa'o //
translated: “Strength” means the power of effort.

original: sra ba 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brten zhing mi zlogs pa thob ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sra ba 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus brten zhing mi zlogs pa thob ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Obtaining firmness” means obtaining firm and unyielding effort.

original: stobs skyed pa de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mthu skyed pa de de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stobs skyed pa de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus kyi mthu skyed pa de de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Endowed with the development of strength” means endowed with the power of effort.

original: gnas de las ma brgal gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni gang bsgrub par bya ba'i gnas de mthar phyin gyi bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas de las ma brgal gyi bar du zhes bya ba ni gang bsgrub par bya ba'i gnas de mthar phyin gyi bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As long as one has not gone beyond that stage means as long as one has not completed the stage that is to be accomplished.

original: lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lha dang lha las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni lha dang lha las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The world with its gods means that it is suitable for the world with its gods and for the world other than gods.

original: dran pa mi tshugs pa ni gang dran pa'i stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /🔽de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: dran pa mi tshugs pa ni gang dran pa'i stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste / de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Unwavering mindfulness is that which is engaged in the power of mindfulness.🔽With reference to that, it is said:

original: de la dran pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dran pa'i stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the power of mindfulness?

original: de zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dran pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: That means the bodhisattva who possesses the power of mindfulness.

original: chos ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa gang yang rung pa'o //
translated: Dharma refers to any of the aggregates, elements, etc.

original: dran pa'i gnas @251a * //
analyzed: dran pa'i gnas @251a * //
translated: The object of mindfulness

original: gang dang gang la zhes bya ba ni dran bas dmigs par bya ba'i yul gang dang gang la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang dang gang la zhes bya ba ni dran bas dmigs par bya ba'i yul gang dang gang la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means the object that is the basis of mindfulness, which means the object that is the domain of mindfulness.

original: sems 'jog pa ni de la dmigs shing mi brjed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'jog pa ni de la dmigs shing mi brjed par byed pa'o //
translated: The placing of the mind is the observation of that and the non-forgetting of it.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs shing mi brjed par byed pa'i dran pa da las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni chos la dmigs shing mi brjed par byed pa'i dran pa da las so //
translated: The observation of that is the mindfulness which observes the Dharma and does not forget it.

original: nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas stong par mi nus zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas med par bya zhing bar du gcod par mi nus pa'o //🔽de'i ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas stong par mi nus zhes bya ba ni dran pa nyams pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas med par bya zhing bar du gcod par mi nus pa'o // de'i ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'o //
translated: It is not possible for any defilement to make it empty means that it is not possible for any defilement, such as the loss of mindfulness, sleep, lethargy, passion, hatred, etc., to make it non-existent and to interrupt it.

original: dran pa'i stobs skyed pa ni dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs skyed pa ni dran pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The power of mindfulness is the strength of mindfulness.

original: 'joms pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'joms pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: The destruction is the abandonment of the defilements.

original: mi brdzi ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The non-subjugation is the non-subjection to the defilements.

original: ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mi tshugs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: The non-adherence to meditative concentration is the full engagement in the strength of meditative concentration.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that, it is said:

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is the power of meditative stabilization?

original: gang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la snyegs te /
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la snyegs te /
translated: The “one” refers to the bodhisattva who possesses the power of meditative stabilization.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that bodhisattva” is to be supplied.

original: 'du 'dzi thams cad las dben par gnas shing zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mang ba'i nang na gnas pa spangs nas ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ste /🔽'dir yang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: 'du 'dzi thams cad las dben par gnas shing zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mang ba'i nang na gnas pa spangs nas ting nge 'dzin la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ste / 'dir yang de lta mod kyi /
translated: “Dwelling in isolation from all distractions” means that, having abandoned dwelling in the midst of many people, one places the mind one-pointedly in meditative stabilization.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, too, the phrase “one who possesses the power of meditative stabilization” is to be supplied.

original: de'i sgra dang tshig gi lam thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i sgra dang tshig gi lam thams cad kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By all the paths of sound and language” means

original: bsam gtan dang po la sgra ca co rnams bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sgra ca co rnams bar du gcod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: that in the first meditative stabilization, the sounds of chatter do not create an obstacle.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po la zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po la zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Because of the power of the bodhisattva’s meditative stabilization, when he enters the first meditative stabilization,

original: de'i bar du gcod pa'i sgra ca co rnams 'don kyang /
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod pa'i sgra ca co rnams 'don kyang /
translated: In the meantime, although they make a lot of noise,

original: de dag bsam gtan de la bar du gcod cing sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag bsam gtan de la bar du gcod cing sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they do not obstruct or obscure that concentration.

original: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag yod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag yod kyang /
translated: Thus, although there are adverse elements,

original: de dag gis mi tshugs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mi tshugs pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called powers because they have the strength to withstand them.

original: de dge ba rtog pa dang dpyod par spyod kyang de'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dge ba rtog pa dang dpyod par spyod kyang de'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although he practices with wholesome investigation and analysis, they do not obscure his second concentration.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: Investigation and analysis are adverse to the second concentration.

original: de bas na bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis spangs te med par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan gnyis pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis spangs te med par byed do //
translated: Therefore, in the second concentration, he abandons and eliminates both investigation and analysis.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa @251b la yang dag par zhugs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa @251b la yang dag par zhugs la /
translated: The bodhisattva who has the power of concentration enters the second concentration.

original: rtog dpyod gnyis spyod kyang de de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog dpyod gnyis spyod kyang de de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that even though one engages in both investigation and analysis, they do not obscure the third concentration.

original: de dag dga' ba dang mgu ba yang skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag dga' ba dang mgu ba yang skyes pa yin la /
translated: They also generate joy and delight.

original: de'i bsam gtan gsum pa la sgrib par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i bsam gtan gsum pa la sgrib par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: And it does not obscure the third concentration.

original: dga' ba dang mgu ba la chags pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mgu ba la chags pa ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Attachment to joy and delight is an obscuration to the third concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan gsum pa la yang dag par zhugs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan gsum pa la yang dag par zhugs la /
translated: The bodhisattva, endowed with the power of concentration, enters the third concentration.

original: chos la dga' zhing mgu ba la yang spyod mod kyi /
analyzed: chos la dga' zhing mgu ba la yang spyod mod kyi /
translated: And he also experiences joy and delight in the Dharma.

original: dga' zhing mgu ba de bsam gtan de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' zhing mgu ba de bsam gtan de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that that joy and delight do not obscure that concentration.

original: de sems can thams cad smin par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad smin par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: For the sake of developing all beings and for the sake of upholding the true Dharma.

original: btang snyoms su mi 'jog par dpyod pa dang bya ba la zhugs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms su mi 'jog par dpyod pa dang bya ba la zhugs pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Not remaining in equanimity, but engaging in analysis and action, is the obscuration to the fourth meditative concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang zhugs la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ting nge 'dzin gyi mthu dang ldan pas bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang zhugs la /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses the power of meditative concentration enters the fourth meditative concentration,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos gzung ba la sogs pa spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed kyang de de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos gzung ba la sogs pa spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byed kyang de de la sgrib par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and although he performs various kinds of conduct such as bringing beings to full maturity and upholding the true Dharma, it is not an obscuration for him.

original: de bsam gtan bzhi po de dag gi gnas te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi po de dag gi gnas te /
translated: That is the abode of the four meditative concentrations.🔽He is not overcome by factors that are adverse to meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis kyang thul bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnas la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis kyang thul bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dang ldan pas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi po rnams kyi gnas la /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses the power of meditative concentration abides in the four meditative concentrations beginning with the first,

original: bsam gtan de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgra ca co dang / rtog dpyod dang / dga' zhing mgu ba dang / btang snyoms ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang bar du gcod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgra ca co dang / rtog dpyod dang / dga' zhing mgu ba dang / btang snyoms ma yin pa rnams kyis kyang bar du gcod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the discordances of those meditative stabilizations, namely, sound, chatter, investigation, analysis, joy, delight, and non-equanimity, are unable to interrupt them.

original: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi gtong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de la mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyang mi gtong la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for “without giving up the state of meditative equipoise,” etc.,

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i mnyam par bzhag pa rnams la rgyun du spyod kyang bsam gtan de dag gi dbang du gyur nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i mnyam par bzhag pa rnams la rgyun du spyod kyang bsam gtan de dag gi dbang du gyur nas /
translated: the meaning is that, although they constantly practice the meditative equipoises of the first meditative stabilization, etc., they are not controlled by those meditative stabilizations.

original: gzugs kyi khams 'ba' zhig tu yang mi skye ste smon lam gyi dbang gis /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams 'ba' zhig tu yang mi skye ste smon lam gyi dbang gis /
translated: They are not born only in the form realm, but, by the power of their aspirational prayers,

original: sems can gyi don dus 'og ma rnams su yang bsams bzhin ni skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gyi don dus 'og ma rnams su yang bsams bzhin ni skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: they are born in the lower realms, as they intend, for the sake of sentient beings.

original: shes rab mi tshugs pa ni gang shes rab kyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab mi tshugs pa ni gang shes rab kyi stobs la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: As for “unassailable wisdom,” it is the one that has entered into the power of wisdom.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that in mind,

original: de la shes rab kyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @252a * //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi stobs gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @252a * //
translated: What is the power of wisdom?

original: gsungs so // 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi mthun par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsungs so // 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi mthun par shes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the knowledge of mundane and supramundane phenomena.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni rig pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni rig pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
translated: Mundane phenomena are the four branches of learning.

original: bzo dang / gso ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / sgra rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: bzo dang / gso ba dang / gtan tshigs dang / sgra rig pa rnams so //
translated: They are the arts, medicine, logic, and grammar.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ni nang rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos ni nang rig pa ste /
translated: Supramundane phenomena are the inner science.

original: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: They are the twelve branches of scripture.

original: mi thul bar shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis sgrib cing bar du gcod mi nus par 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi thul bar shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyis sgrib cing bar du gcod mi nus par 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams shes pa'o //
translated: The power of wisdom is the knowledge of mundane and supramundane phenomena without being obstructed or hindered by the opposing factors of wisdom.

original: chos de rnams la mi thul bar shes pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos de rnams la mi thul bar shes pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively teach the knowledge of those phenomena without being obstructed,

original: tshe rabs tshe rabs su yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe rabs tshe rabs su yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “In life after life, they will be learned in the five fields of knowledge.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' la mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad ni 'jig rten pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa bstan to //🔽gang yang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la mngon du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yan chad ni 'jig rten pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa bstan to // gang yang 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The phrase becomes manifest to the bodhisattva indicates the knowledge that is invincible with regard to mundane qualities.

original: rjes su rtogs te zhes bya ba yan chad ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs te zhes bya ba yan chad ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos la mi thul bar shes pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase with regard to supramundane qualities indicates the knowledge that is invincible with regard to supramundane qualities.

original: tshe rabs tshe rabs su zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i gnas de dag tu bdag gi phung po skyes shing tshe blangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs tshe rabs su zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i gnas de dag tu bdag gi phung po skyes shing tshe blangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in all his lives means that he takes up a life in those divine and human states.

original: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: The phrase he refers to the bodhisattva.

original: bzo'i las ni dra ba bcom pa la sogs te /🔽bzo rig pa rang gi ming gis bstan to //
analyzed: bzo'i las ni dra ba bcom pa la sogs te / bzo rig pa rang gi ming gis bstan to //
translated: The phrase arts and crafts refers to such things as weaving.🔽The word arts indicates the other branches of learning.

original: rig pa zhes smos pa ni rig pa'i gnas lhag ma gsum bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa zhes smos pa ni rig pa'i gnas lhag ma gsum bstan to //
translated: The word knowledge indicates the remaining three branches of learning.

original: sngags ni gzhan gyi dmag gi sde mnan pa dang / sbrul la sogs pa'i dug med par bya ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: sngags ni gzhan gyi dmag gi sde mnan pa dang / sbrul la sogs pa'i dug med par bya ba'i thabs so //
translated: The word mantras refers to the means of repelling the armies of enemies and of removing the poison of snakes, etc.

original: stobs ni mtshon cha 'phang ba dang / glang po che 'degs pa la sogs pa'i rtsal lo //
analyzed: stobs ni mtshon cha 'phang ba dang / glang po che 'degs pa la sogs pa'i rtsal lo //
translated: Power is the strength of the body, such as the ability to throw weapons and lift elephants.

original: mngon du 'gyur ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du 'gyur ba ni shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: Manifestation is the state of being known.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni las su bya ba dang / shes par bya ba gtso bor gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni las su bya ba dang / shes par bya ba gtso bor gyur pa ste /
translated: The word “supreme” means that which is most important to be done and to be known.

original: bya dka' ba ni bsgrub cing shes par bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: bya dka' ba ni bsgrub cing shes par bya dka' ba'o //
translated: Difficult to do means difficult to accomplish and difficult to know.

original: bzod par dka' ba ni de dag sgrub pa na sdug bsngal nyams su blang dka' ba'o ;
analyzed: bzod par dka' ba ni de dag sgrub pa na sdug bsngal nyams su blang dka' ba'o ;
translated: Difficult to bear means difficult to practice when accomplishing them, because of the suffering involved.

original: / thob bar dka' ba ni 'bras bu thob par bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: / thob bar dka' ba ni 'bras bu thob par bya dka' ba'o //
translated: Difficult to attain means difficult to obtain as a result.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dang gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gang gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i lam de dag shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos gang dang gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gang gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba'i lam de dag shes so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: By which supramundane dharmas one transcends the world means by which noble path one attains nirvana.

original: bcas pa @252b zhes bya ba'i sgras mi dang bdud la sogs pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa @252b zhes bya ba'i sgras mi dang bdud la sogs pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The word “etc.” includes humans, demons, and so on.

original: mi brdzi ba ni de dag gi shes pas mi thub pa'o //
analyzed: mi brdzi ba ni de dag gi shes pas mi thub pa'o //
translated: Not being crushed means that they cannot be overcome by the knowledge of those.

original: stobs lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to /🔽// / dran pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel pa dang / dga' ba shin tu 'brel pa dang / bag yangs shin tu 'brel pa dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: stobs lnga mi zad pa bshad zin to / // / dran pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel pa dang / brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel pa dang / dga' ba shin tu 'brel pa dang / bag yangs shin tu 'brel pa dang / ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa dang /
translated: The five powers have been explained as inexhaustible.

original: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the close application of mindfulness, the close application of knowledge, the close application of effort, the close application of joy, the close application of pliancy, the close application of concentration, and the close application of equanimity,

original: btsun ba sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun ba sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the bodhisattvas' factors of enlightenment.

original: 'di bsdus pa'i don mthong ba'i lam bstan par yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di bsdus pa'i don mthong ba'i lam bstan par yang sbyar ro //
translated: This should also be applied to the teaching of the path of seeing, which is the summarized meaning.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya ba la /
translated: As for the factors of enlightenment,

original: byang chub ni zad pa mi skye ba'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa mi skye ba'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin la bya'o //
translated: enlightenment should be understood as the non-conceptual nature of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: dran pa la sogs pa bdun po 'di rnams ni byang chub de thob par byed pa'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa bdun po 'di rnams ni byang chub de thob par byed pa'i rgyu 'am /
translated: These seven, beginning with mindfulness, are the causes for attaining enlightenment.

original: grogs yin pas na yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: grogs yin pas na yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: These seven, beginning with mindfulness, are called members because they are the cause or the helper for attaining that enlightenment.

original: ji ltar yan lag yin par ni phyis bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag yin par ni phyis bshad do //
translated: How they are members will be explained later.

original: de dag mi zad pa yang dran par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //🔽dran pa shin tu 'brel pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i nges pa nyams 'og tu chud cing /
analyzed: de dag mi zad pa yang dran par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o // dran pa shin tu 'brel pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni yang dag pa'i nges pa nyams 'og tu chud cing /
translated: They are also inexhaustible because the dharmas of mindfulness, etc. are inexhaustible.

original: dran pa yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has well-connected mindfulness enters into the realization of the right path and obtains the enlightenment member of right mindfulness.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that, it is said:

original: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽dran pa shin tu 'brel pa la ji lta ba de bzhin /
analyzed: de la dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhen zhes bya ba gsungs so // dran pa shin tu 'brel pa la ji lta ba de bzhin /
translated: “What is the enlightenment member of right mindfulness?”

original: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa'i bar du ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa'i bar du ci rigs par shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as it is for well-connected mindfulness, so it is for well-connected investigation of the teachings, up to well-connected equanimity.🔽One should understand this as it is appropriate.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul ni gong ma bzhin du lta'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul ni gong ma bzhin du lta'o //
translated: Here also, the method of teaching and explaining should be seen as above.

original: dran pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos rnams sems la gsal zhing ma brjed pa'i dran pa gang gis so //
analyzed: dran pa gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos rnams sems la gsal zhing ma brjed pa'i dran pa gang gis so //
translated: By what mindfulness? By that mindfulness which is clear and not forgetful of the teachings in the mind.

original: chos rnams rtog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: chos rnams rtog par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The teachings are investigated. This is a word of brief indication.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshig go //
translated: The rest are words of explanation.

original: dran pas rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dran pas rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The teachings that are investigated by mindfulness are also threefold:

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa dang de'i lam rtogs pa dang / lam de ston pa'i gzhung rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa dang de'i lam rtogs pa dang / lam de ston pa'i gzhung rtogs pa'o //
translated: the realization of the dharma-dhātu, the realization of its path, and the realization of the scriptures that teach that path.

original: chos rnams la so sor rtog pa zhes bya bas chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos rnams la so sor rtog pa zhes bya bas chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The investigation of the teachings shows the realization of the dharma-dhātu.

original: so sor gyi sgra phyin ci ma log pa'i sgrar 'gro bas chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du gyur pa'o //🔽chos rnams la dpyod pa dang zhes bya bas @253a * //
analyzed: so sor gyi sgra phyin ci ma log pa'i sgrar 'gro bas chos rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du gyur pa'o // chos rnams la dpyod pa dang zhes bya bas @253a * //
translated: Since the word “individually” becomes the word “unmistakenly,” the dharma-dhātu of the teachings is manifested.

original: de'i lam rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de'i lam rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The analysis of the teachings shows the realization of its path.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par bya ba'i lam gang yin pa khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs par bya ba'i lam gang yin pa khong du chud pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding of the path that leads to the realization of the realm of reality.

original: chos rnams la kun du 'gro ba zhes bya bas lam de ston pa'i gzhung rtogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos rnams la kun du 'gro ba zhes bya bas lam de ston pa'i gzhung rtogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “with regard to all things” in the above passage indicates the understanding of the scriptures that teach that path.

original: lam de ston pa'i gsung rab kyi chos rnams gang dang gang gi phyogs su rtogs pa sems la rtogs shing gzhan la ston pa la yang nor pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam de ston pa'i gsung rab kyi chos rnams gang dang gang gi phyogs su rtogs pa sems la rtogs shing gzhan la ston pa la yang nor pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because there is no error in the understanding of the scriptures that teach that path, in the understanding of the Dharma that is taught in the scriptures, and in the teaching of that understanding to others.

original: de yang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis de /
analyzed: de yang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis de /
translated: Moreover, that understanding is by means of the wisdom that comes from reflection and the wisdom that comes from meditation.

original: chos rnams la bsam pa dang zhes bya bas bsam pa'i shes rab bstan te /
analyzed: chos rnams la bsam pa dang zhes bya bas bsam pa'i shes rab bstan te /
translated: The phrase “with regard to all things” indicates the wisdom that comes from reflection.

original: chos rnams kyi don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi don khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because one has understood the meaning of the Dharma.

original: chos rnams la rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya bas bsgom pa'i shes rab bstan te /
analyzed: chos rnams la rjes su rtogs pa zhes bya bas bsgom pa'i shes rab bstan te /
translated: The phrase “with regard to all things” indicates the wisdom that comes from meditation.

original: bsam pas rnyed pa'i chos la yang nas yang du bsgom pa'i phyir te de ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pas rnyed pa'i chos la yang nas yang du bsgom pa'i phyir te de ni dran pa'o //
translated: It is because one meditates repeatedly on the Dharma that one has understood through reflection.

original: rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel pa ni gang chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag la shin tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu shes pa shin tu 'brel pa ni gang chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag la shin tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Very related knowledge is that which is very much engaged in the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that in mind,

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, What is the enlightenment factor of investigation of phenomena? and so on.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of thorough investigation is

original: rnam par 'byed pa shes pa'o //🔽de nyid kyi don gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir gang dang gang /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa shes pa'o // de nyid kyi don gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir gang dang gang /
translated: the knowledge of investigation.

original: ji lta ji lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji lta ji lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning, it is said, Whatever and however... and so on.

original: chos gang dang gang /
analyzed: chos gang dang gang /
translated: Whatever phenomena

original: gang gi cha dang phyogs su gtogs pa ji lta ji lta bur de'i zla dang phyogs su bslan zhing /
analyzed: gang gi cha dang phyogs su gtogs pa ji lta ji lta bur de'i zla dang phyogs su bslan zhing /
translated: belong to whatever part or aspect, however they are placed in pairs and compared,

original: dbye bar bya ba'i chos de dang de dag la 'di ni 'di'i phyogs su gtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang dang gang gi zla la gtogs pa shes shing /
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i chos de dang de dag la 'di ni 'di'i phyogs su gtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gang dang gang gi zla la gtogs pa shes shing /
translated: in those phenomena that are to be distinguished, it is said, This belongs to this part and so on, and whatever belongs to the pair is known.

original: cha char so sor rnam par 'byed pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: cha char so sor rnam par 'byed pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that analyzes each part individually.

original: brda dang rnam par nges pa ni tha snyad dang gtan la phab pa'i don la bya ste ;
analyzed: brda dang rnam par nges pa ni tha snyad dang gtan la phab pa'i don la bya ste ;
translated: Sign and ascertainment refer to conventional expressions and the meaning of the teaching.

original: nges pa'i don nas rnam par nges pa'i bar gyi chos gang dang gang gsungs pa de dag kyang de dag so so'i sde tshan du gtogs par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don nas rnam par nges pa'i bar gyi chos gang dang gang gsungs pa de dag kyang de dag so so'i sde tshan du gtogs par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that these teachings, from the definitive meaning up to ascertainment, belong to such and such a class.

original: brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs te /🔽de bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus shin tu 'brel pa ni brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs te / de bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The phrase he is intent on effort means that he has entered the path of effort, the factor of enlightenment.

original: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says, What is the factor of enlightenment that is effort?

original: 'di zhes bya ba'i tshig gong du bstan pa chos rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa snyegs so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba'i tshig gong du bstan pa chos rnam par 'byed pa la sogs pa snyegs so //
translated: The phrase this one refers to the previously mentioned teachings, such as the differentiation of the dharmas.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa ni chos de dag sems la mi brjed par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa ni chos de dag sems la mi brjed par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The phrase he is intent on means that he holds those dharmas in his mind without forgetting them.

original: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra thams cad dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba'i sgra thams cad dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word again is connected with all the previous words.

original: spro @253b ba ni chos de dag sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: spro @253b ba ni chos de dag sgrub par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Enthusiasm is the desire to practice those dharmas.

original: stobs ni le lo'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stobs ni le lo'i dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Strength is not being overpowered by laziness.

original: brtul ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa'o //
analyzed: brtul ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan gyis mi tshugs pa'o //
translated: Courage is not being overcome by other defilements.

original: phyir mi ldog pa ni dge ba bsgrub pa mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni dge ba bsgrub pa mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: Non-retrogression is not abandoning the practice of virtue.

original: 'dun pa ni chos de dag la de bzhin du yid ches nas byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni chos de dag la de bzhin du yid ches nas byed pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is acting with confidence in those dharmas as they are.

original: mthu ni bdud la sogs pas mi zlogs pa'o ;
analyzed: mthu ni bdud la sogs pas mi zlogs pa'o ;
translated: Power is not being turned back by Mara, etc.

original: / brtson 'grus mi gtong ba ni bsgom pa rgyun du bya ba mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus mi gtong ba ni bsgom pa rgyun du bya ba mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not abandoning effort is not abandoning the continuity of cultivation.

original: lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / sa bcu'i lam rtogs par bya ba'o //🔽phyir ni de dag gi don du'am /
analyzed: lam mngon par rtogs par bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad dang / sa bcu'i lam rtogs par bya ba'o // phyir ni de dag gi don du'am /
translated: Realizing the path is realizing the eightfold noble path and the path of the ten stages.🔽For the sake of those, or for their sake, is the meaning of for the sake of.

original: ched du'o // brtson pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ched du'o // brtson pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'bad pa 'di ni zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This effort is the meaning of this striving.

original: dga' ba shin tu 'brel pa ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba shin tu 'brel pa ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: Being fully engaged in joy is being fully engaged in the limb of enlightenment of joy.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In this regard,

original: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What is the enlightenment factor of joy? ”

original: de yang dga' ba ji lta bu gang gis gang bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: de yang dga' ba ji lta bu gang gis gang bsgrubs shing /
translated: Moreover, what kind of joy is it, by which one accomplishes what,🔽and by which one abandons its opposite?

original: de'i mthun pa spangs pa ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mthun pa spangs pa ni dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the enlightenment factor of joy.

original: de la dga' ba ji lta bus ni /
analyzed: de la dga' ba ji lta bus ni /
translated: What kind of joy is it?

original: dus gsum gyi chos thob par dga' ba'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi chos thob par dga' ba'i dga' ba ste /
translated: It is the joy of obtaining the Dharma of the three times.

original: chos la rab tu dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: chos la rab tu dga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the three phrases beginning with “delight in the Dharma. ”

original: de la 'das pa'i chos rnams la dmigs nas /
analyzed: de la 'das pa'i chos rnams la dmigs nas /
translated: With regard to that, when one focuses on past phenomena,

original: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la dga' ba'o //
translated: the arising of mental conviction is delight in the Dharma.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos la dmigs nas /
translated: When one focuses on future phenomena,

original: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la mos pa'o //
analyzed: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la mos pa'o //
translated: the arising of mental conviction is conviction in the Dharma.

original: da ltar gyi chos la dmigs nas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi chos la dmigs nas /
translated: When one focuses on present phenomena,

original: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems la mos pa skyes pa ni chos la mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: the arising of mental conviction is supreme delight in the Dharma.

original: dga' ba gang yin pa de nyid kyis rgyu byas nas sems zhum pa dang spros par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba gang yin pa de nyid kyis rgyu byas nas sems zhum pa dang spros par gyur pa ste /
translated: The very joy that is the cause, the mind is not downcast and is not agitated.

original: sems ma gong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: sems ma gong ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: The two phrases “the mind is not downcast” and so on indicate this.

original: sems ma gong ba ni mi nus so snyam du sems zhum zhing dga' ba sro shi bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems ma gong ba ni mi nus so snyam du sems zhum zhing dga' ba sro shi bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The mind is not downcast, thinking “I cannot do it,” and it is not agitated, thinking “I cannot do it quickly.”

original: dad cing 'dun pa ni dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa skyes shing lhag par 'jug par sems mos pa'o //
analyzed: dad cing 'dun pa ni dga' ba khyad par du 'phags pa skyes shing lhag par 'jug par sems mos pa'o //
translated: Faith and aspiration are the superior joy that arises and the mental disposition that engages with it.

original: gang bsgrub pa ni dga' ba des lus dang sems las su rung ba bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: gang bsgrub pa ni dga' ba des lus dang sems las su rung ba bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of what is to be achieved is the accomplishment of physical and mental fitness through that joy.

original: de yang lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de yang lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs par 'gyur ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: That is indicated by the phrase “one becomes physically and mentally fit.”

original: lus las su rung ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rten du gyur pas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mi byed cing /
analyzed: lus las su rung ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rten du gyur pas nyon mongs pa skye ba'i rgyu mi byed cing /
translated: Physical fitness is the form aggregate that serves as the basis for the mind and does not act as a cause for the generation of the mental afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mi mthun par gnas @254a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba dang rjes su mi mthun par gnas @254a * //
translated: It is the state of being in which the mental afflictions are not generated.

original: pa'o ; / sems las su rung ba ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i dbang du ma gyur la /
analyzed: pa'o ; / sems las su rung ba ni zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i dbang du ma gyur la /
translated: The mind becomes serviceable when it is no longer subject to low spirits and excitedness.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bas don rtogs shing rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bas don rtogs shing rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa'o //
translated: It becomes serviceable when it is able to realize the meaning and to remain one-pointedly, through the union of serenity and insight.

original: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs sbong ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: de mi mthun pa'i phyogs sbong ba ni dga' ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: The elimination of the counteragents to that is the elimination of the counteragents to joy,

original: mthong ba'i lam la bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bar du gcod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba ste /
translated: or the elimination of the counteragents that obstruct the path of insight.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa rnams sel ba zhes bya bas bstan to //🔽shin tu sbyangs pa'i shin tu 'brel ba ni /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa rnams sel ba zhes bya bas bstan to // shin tu sbyangs pa'i shin tu 'brel ba ni /
translated: This is indicated by the phrase “the removal of the afflictions.🔽” The connection with the factor of complete acceptance is

original: gang shin tu skyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang shin tu skyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: the complete acceptance of the factor of complete acceptance.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /🔽de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas / de la shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to that, it is said:🔽“What is the factor of complete acceptance of complete acceptance?

original: de yang gang gis gang spangs nas /
analyzed: de yang gang gis gang spangs nas /
translated: ” This is also indicated by the phrase “the removal of the afflictions.🔽”

original: dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The ability to remain one-pointedly on the object of meditation is called the factor of awakening of pliancy.

original: gang gis spangs she na /
analyzed: gang gis spangs she na /
translated: By what is it abandoned?

original: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang lus shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “By what is called physical pliancy, etc.”

original: gong du bshad pa'i lus dang sems las su rung bas spangs so //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i lus dang sems las su rung bas spangs so //
translated: It is abandoned by the physical and mental workability explained above.

original: gang spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs so //
analyzed: gang spangs pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa spangs so //
translated: What is abandoned? Afflictions, etc. are abandoned.

original: dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa ni /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul la rtse gcig tu gnas par nus pa ni /
translated: The ability to remain one-pointedly on the object of meditation

original: zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu 'jug par nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i dmigs pa la sems rtse gcig tu 'jug par nus pa'o //
translated: is the ability to engage the mind one-pointedly on the object of meditation that engages serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa'i dmigs pa ni /
