translated: The object of meditation of serenity

original: zhi gnas la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la dmigs pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the object of meditation of serenity.

original: ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin shin tu 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection with concentration

original: gang ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: is the one who has entered the factor of awakening of concentration.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of that,

original: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The passage beginning What is the factor of awakening that is right concentration?

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin gang gis de bzhin nyid so sor rang gis rig cing de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin gang gis de bzhin nyid so sor rang gis rig cing de bzhin nyid mngon sum du byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that concentration by means of which one individually cognizes suchness and realizes suchness is called the factor of awakening that is right concentration.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pas so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la sems rtse gcig tu gzhag pas so //
translated: The phrase one's mind becomes concentrated means that one's mind becomes one-pointed with respect to emptiness.

original: chos kyi ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so sor rang gis rig par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi ye shes mngon par 'tshang rgya'i zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so sor rang gis rig par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase one realizes the pristine wisdom of phenomena means that one individually cognizes nonconceptual pristine wisdom.

original: mnyam par mi gzhag pas ni ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems spros pa dang bcas pas ni rang bzhin rig par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam par mi gzhag pas ni ma yin zhes bya bas ni sems spros pa dang bcas pas ni rang bzhin rig par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase not by means of a mind that is not concentrated means that one cannot cognize the nature of reality with a mind that is discursive.

original: chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos de dag mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one realizes those phenomena means that one realizes the nature of reality.

original: stong pa nyid mngon sum du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon sum du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that emptiness is directly perceived.

original: @254b tshig de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: @254b tshig de dag ni so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: These words are spoken from the perspective of ordinary beings.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: From the perspective of śrāvakas and so on, it says “view” and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dor ba tsam gyi ye shes rang gis rig cing chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dor ba tsam gyi ye shes rang gis rig cing chos kyi dbyings mngon sum du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The wisdom that merely abandons the afflictions is not self-cognizant and does not directly perceive the dharmadhātu.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad du stong pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / tha dad med par shes nas de gnyis mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad du stong pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / tha dad med par shes nas de gnyis mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, knowing that all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are the same in emptiness and are not different, one will directly awaken to those two. This is the meaning.

original: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: btang snyoms shin tu 'brel pa ni /
translated: The connection with equanimity is

original: gang btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gang btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la rab tu zhugs pa ste /
translated: the one who has entered the branch of awakening that is equanimity.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From his perspective,

original: de la btang snyoms yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la btang snyoms yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says “therein, equanimity” and so on.

original: sems yongs su mi gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang mi bde ba gang gi dbang du yang mi 'gyur zhing chags pa dang / khong khro bas sems kun du mi zin pa'o //
analyzed: sems yongs su mi gtugs pa zhes bya ba ni yid bde ba dang mi bde ba gang gi dbang du yang mi 'gyur zhing chags pa dang / khong khro bas sems kun du mi zin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “his mind is not overwhelmed” means that he is not subject to any kind of satisfaction or dissatisfaction, and his mind is not seized by attachment or aversion.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi 'phrogs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “he is not carried away by worldly objects” means

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang mtho bar mi sems /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang mtho bar mi sems /
translated: that he is not subject to the eight worldly concerns, and that he does not feel superior when he obtains gain and honor, etc.,

original: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang dma' bar mi sems pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa la sogs pa dang ldan yang dma' bar mi sems pa'i phyir /
translated: nor does he feel inferior when he does not obtain them.

original: de dag gis mi sgul ba ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mi sgul ba ni btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The phrase “he is unmoved by them” means that he is indifferent to them.

original: gnod pa med pa ni gnod pa byas kyang gnod par mi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa ni gnod pa byas kyang gnod par mi tshor ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he is not harmed” means that he does not feel harmed when he is harmed.

original: 'phrogs pa med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phrogs pa med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “he is not carried away” means that he is not subject to adverse elements.

original: rjes su chags pa dang zhe 'gras pa med pa ni 'dod chags dang khong khro med pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang zhe 'gras pa med pa ni 'dod chags dang khong khro med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he is free of attachment and aversion” means that he is free of desire and anger.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i lam dang mthun pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa'i lam dang mthun pa ni /
translated: The limb of the path that is in conformity with the noble truths is

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dbang du ma gyur pa ste /
translated: not under the control of the afflictions.

original: btang snyoms pa las 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms pa las 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the limb of the path because it establishes the limb of the path of equanimity.

original: 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gzhag pa yang /
analyzed: 'di dag byang chub kyi yan lag tu gzhag pa yang /
translated: The establishment of these as the limbs of enlightenment is🔽as follows.

original: de la dran pa ni rten gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni rten gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the limb of support,

original: dran pa nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: because when mindfulness is present,

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad sems la gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad sems la gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: all virtuous qualities are clear in the mind.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni /
translated: The analysis of phenomena is

original: rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi yan lag ste /
translated: the limb of nature,

original: de nyid byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Effort is the limb of definite emergence,

original: des ji srid 'gro bar bya bar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji srid 'gro bar bya bar phyin par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one goes as far as one needs to go.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the limb of benefit,

original: des rgyud la tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rgyud la tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it satisfies the mindstream.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go //🔽de la shin @255a * //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go // de la shin @255a * //
translated: Pliancy, concentration, and equanimity are the limbs of non-affliction.

original: tu sbyangs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: tu sbyangs pa ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Pliancy is non-affliction,

original: des gnas ngan len sbong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gnas ngan len sbong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it eliminates the negative reflex actions.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Concentration is non-affliction,

original: de la gnas pa'i gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i gnas gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it transforms the basis of affliction.

original: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is non-affliction,

original: de'i dus na chags sems dang yid bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de'i dus na chags sems dang yid bde ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because at that time one is free from attachment and mental ease.

original: / byang chub kyi yan lag mi zad pa bdun bshad zin to /🔽// / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / shin tu rtog pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / shin tu byung ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / mthu che ba dang / bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa dang /
analyzed: / byang chub kyi yan lag mi zad pa bdun bshad zin to /🔽// / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / shin tu rtog pa dang / dul ba dang / zhi ba dang / rab tu zhi ba dang / shin tu byung ba dang / dga' ba dang ldan pa dang / mthu che ba dang / bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa dang /
translated: The seven limbs of enlightenment have been explained as inexhaustible.🔽The limbs of the Way are eight: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: spros pa'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spros pa'i rnal 'byor la spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the yoga of elaboration,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattvas’ path is inexhaustible.”

original: de dag las 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas ni bsdus pa'i don bsgom pa'i lam bstan la /
analyzed: de dag las 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas ni bsdus pa'i don bsgom pa'i lam bstan la /
translated: Among those, the eightfold noble path teaches the path of cultivation.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis ni sbyor ba bstan pa sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis ni sbyor ba bstan pa sbyar ro //
translated: Tranquility and insight teach the application.

original: de mi zad pa yang des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang des bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi zad pa'i phyir //
translated: That is inexhaustible because the phenomena that are accomplished by it are inexhaustible.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i lam rnams kyang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i lam rnams kyang mi zad pa'o //
translated: The paths that accomplish it are also inexhaustible.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /🔽lam zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste / lam zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, it should be understood in the manner of teaching and explanation.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The teaching manner is from “What is called the path” up to “right concentration.”

original: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: The explanation manner is the rest.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: The so-called path is the eightfold path of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa rnams ye shes gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub 'grub pa'i ye shes de la lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ye shes gang gis bla na med pa'i byang chub 'grub pa'i ye shes de la lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The path is the gnosis by which the noble ones accomplish unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: lta ba la sogs pa brgyad po de rnams lam gyi ye shes de'i grogs su gyur pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa brgyad po de rnams lam gyi ye shes de'i grogs su gyur pa'i phyir yan lag ces bya ste /
translated: The eight, beginning with right view, are called “limbs” because they are the aids to that path-gnosis.

original: 'jig rten pa'i log par lta ba las bzlog pas na yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i log par lta ba las bzlog pas na yang dag pa'o //
translated: It is “correct” because it is the opposite of the wrong views of the world.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i lta ba thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is free from conceptualization attains correct view on the path of meditation.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas yang dag pa'i lta ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to him, it is said: “What is correct view? ” and so on.

original: gang 'di 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang 'di 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, “the noble supramundane” means

original: zag pa med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: correct view is the nondual, uncontaminated gnosis.

original: de nyid gang yin pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid gang yin pa rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively teach just that,

original: bdag tu lta ba la kun nas langs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la kun nas langs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te //
translated: he said, “not arisen from the view of a self,” and so on.

original: @255b bdag tu lta ba las byung zhing skyes pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @255b bdag tu lta ba las byung zhing skyes pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not arisen from the view of a self.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod par lta ba yang mtshan mar lta ba yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod par lta ba yang mtshan mar lta ba yin pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin
translated: With regard to “virtuous and non-virtuous,” and so on, the view that virtuous and non-virtuous karma and the effects of karma exist is also a view of signs, and therefore is not supramundane correct view.

original: te / de dag yod par lta ba las kyang byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: te / de dag yod par lta ba las kyang byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is not arisen from the view that they exist.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to “saṃsāra and nirvāṇa,” and so on,

original: ji tsam du mtshan mar lta ba de thams cad las byung ba ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan mar lta ba de thams cad las byung ba ma yin par ston te /
translated: he teaches that it is not arisen from all views of signs.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yod par lta na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang yod par lta na /
translated: If one views nirvāṇa as existent,

original: dngos por lta ba yin pas yang dag pa'i lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por lta ba yin pas yang dag pa'i lta bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is a view of real things, it is not right view.

original: shin tu rnam par rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtog pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtog pa thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is very conceptual is one who has attained right thought on the path of meditation.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽de la mi rtog ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i yul de dag la mi rtog pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // de la mi rtog ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa skye ba'i yul de dag la mi rtog pa 'am /
translated: With reference to him, it is said: What is right thought?

original: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i kun du rtog pa mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye ba'i kun du rtog pa mi skyed pa'o //
translated: Here, “not conceptualizing” means not conceptualizing those objects that give rise to the afflictions, or not giving rise to the conceptualization that gives rise to the afflictions.

original: dul ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na /
analyzed: dul ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na /
translated: The disciplined bodhisattva is one who, on the path of meditation,

original: yang dag pa'i ngag gis bsdus pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag gis bsdus pa /
translated: has attained right speech,

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste /🔽de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste / de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: and has attained the morality pleasing to the noble ones.🔽With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i rtog pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is right thought?

original: bdag la yang yongs su gdung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sems la 'gyod pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la yang yongs su gdung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sems la 'gyod pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not torment oneself and so on means that one does not give rise to regret in one's own or others' minds.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni tshig des bdag dang gzhan 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa skye bar mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed pa ni tshig des bdag dang gzhan 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa skye bar mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not afflicting means that with those words one does not give rise to the affliction of desire in oneself or others.

original: mi gnod pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sems dang lus la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnod pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi sems dang lus la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Not harming means that one does not give rise to suffering in the minds or bodies of oneself or others.

original: lam la legs par 'jug pa ni lam dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: lam la legs par 'jug pa ni lam dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Engaging well in the path means being in accord with the path.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la brtson pa'i ngag de dang ldan zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshul gyis bdag dang gzhan gnyis ka la yang mi gnod /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la brtson pa'i ngag de dang ldan zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa lta bu'i tshul gyis bdag dang gzhan gnyis ka la yang mi gnod /
translated: Speech endowed with that which is directed towards meditative equipoise means that, in the manner described above, one does not harm either oneself or others.

original: 'phags pa'i lam de thob par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i ngag de ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam de thob par byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i ngag de ni /
translated: That speech becomes the cause for attaining the noble path.

original: 'khrugs pa'am ma snyoms pa med pas na /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'am ma snyoms pa med pas na /
translated: Since it is not agitated or unbalanced,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called 'meditative equipoise'.

original: zhi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bsdus pa /
analyzed: zhi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' bsdus pa /
translated: Peaceful bodhisattvas are those on the path of meditation who have gathered correct action.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste /
translated: The peaceful bodhisattva is one who, even on the path of meditation, has attained the morality pleasing to the noble ones, which includes right action.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na zhes bya @256a * //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' gang zhe na zhes bya @256a * //
translated: What is right action?

original: ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: las gnag pa ni mi dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: las gnag pa ni mi dge ba bcu'o //
translated: Black action is the ten unvirtuous actions.

original: las dkar ba ni dge ba bcu'o //
analyzed: las dkar ba ni dge ba bcu'o //
translated: White action is the ten virtuous actions.

original: las dkar gnag ni dge ba bcu mi dge ba dang 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: las dkar gnag ni dge ba bcu mi dge ba dang 'dres pa'o //
translated: Mixed action is the ten virtuous and unvirtuous actions mixed together.

original: las gang mi gnag mi dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: las gang mi gnag mi dkar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: As for the action that is neither black nor white, and so on,

original: zag pa med pa las 'khor ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zag pa med pa las 'khor ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is the uncontaminated action that does not become the cause of cyclic existence.

original: las la rton pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las la rton pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Relying on action means

original: de ltar zag pa med pa'i dbyings nyid du rtogs kyang /
analyzed: de ltar zag pa med pa'i dbyings nyid du rtogs kyang /
translated: that even though one realizes the uncontaminated realm,

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa med par yang mi rton zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa med par yang mi rton zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: one does not rely on the nonexistence of the maturation of action.

original: rab tu zhi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas bsdus pa /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas bsdus pa /
translated: The bodhisattva of complete pacification is one who, on the path of meditation, is included in right livelihood.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is very peaceful is one who, on the path of meditation, has attained the morality pleasing to the Noble Ones, which is included in right livelihood.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What is right livelihood?

original: gong du bshad zin pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad zin pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad pa'o //
translated: What has been explained above is not explained here.

original: dgang sla ba ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms ngan don gyis mgu ba'o //
analyzed: dgang sla ba ni chos gos dang bsod snyoms ngan don gyis mgu ba'o //
translated: Easy to satisfy means being satisfied with inferior Dharma robes and alms-food.

original: gso sla ba ni cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'o //
analyzed: gso sla ba ni cung zad tsam gyis chog pa'o //
translated: Easy to nourish means being content with just a little.

original: cho ga gang bzang po'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'i cho ga dang / tshul khrims bcos pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: cho ga gang bzang po'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni spyod pa'i cho ga dang / tshul khrims bcos pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Good conduct means that one has the nature of good conduct, not conduct that is contrived morality.

original: rang bzhin gyis shin tu dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis shin tu dag pa'o //
translated: It is very pure by nature.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni nyes pa phra mo yang med pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni nyes pa phra mo yang med pa'o //
translated: Blameless means being without even the slightest fault.

original: 'phags pas gnang ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'i 'tsho ba de 'phags pas gnang ba'i 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pas gnang ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bu'i 'tsho ba de 'phags pas gnang ba'i 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: The noble one's approval is the noble one's approval of the livelihood explained above.

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba thob pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has gone forth is one who has attained right effort on the path of cultivation.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With him in mind,

original: de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i rtsol ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, What is right effort? and so on.

original: rtsol ba gang yang dag par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsol ba gang yang dag par zhes bya ba la /
translated: Effort that is right means

original: rtsol ba gang byas shing brtsal na 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun zhing bden pa bzhi dang mthun pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du gtod pa'i rtsol ba de'i rjes su 'gro ba de dang mthun par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol
analyzed: rtsol ba gang byas shing brtsal na 'phags pa'i lam dang rjes su mthun zhing bden pa bzhi dang mthun pa la mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam du gtod pa'i rtsol ba de'i rjes su 'gro ba de dang mthun par byed pa ni yang dag pa'i rtsol
translated: that when one makes and exerts effort, it is in accord with the noble path and in accord with the four truths, and the effort that leads to the path that goes to nirvana.

original: ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That which follows and accords with that effort is called right effort.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na tshig dang don mi brjed pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na tshig dang don mi brjed pa thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who possesses delight is one who has attained the non-forgetting of the word and meaning on the path of meditation.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Herein, what is right mindfulness?

original: shin tu nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag tu rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu nye bar gzhag pa ni rtag tu rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is well-established, always one-pointedly established.

original: mi sgul ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi sgul ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is unshakable, not able to be shaken by counteragents.

original: dran pa ni yang dag @256b ba'i lta ba dang mthun pas so //
analyzed: dran pa ni yang dag @256b ba'i lta ba dang mthun pas so //
translated: It is mindfulness, in conformity with right view.

original: gya gyu med pa ni log pa'i lta ba spangs pas so //
analyzed: gya gyu med pa ni log pa'i lta ba spangs pas so //
translated: It is without crookedness, having abandoned wrong views.

original: 'khor ba'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs la lta ba ni nyon mongs pa rga shi la sogs pa la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon gyi nyes dmigs la lta ba ni nyon mongs pa rga shi la sogs pa la rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the view of the disadvantage of the faults of cyclic existence, the investigation of the afflictions, old age, death, and so on.

original: 'dren pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug pa'o //🔽dran pa ni bshad pa'i chos kyi tshig ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam la 'jug pa'o // dran pa ni bshad pa'i chos kyi tshig ma brjed pa'o //
translated: It is the guide, the entry into the path of nirvana.🔽It is mindfulness, the non-forgetting of the words of the Dharma that is being explained.

original: gzhungs pa ni bshad pa'i tshig gi don ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhungs pa ni bshad pa'i tshig gi don ma brjed pa'o //
translated: It is intelligence, the non-forgetting of the meaning of the words that are being explained.

original: 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos ma brjed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'i chos ma brjed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The so-called noble path is the teaching of the Dharma to be accomplished, without forgetting.

original: mthu che ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na bsams pa'i don rdzogs par thob pa ste /
analyzed: mthu che ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang bsgom pa'i lam na bsams pa'i don rdzogs par thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva of great power is one who, on the path of cultivation, has completely attained the goal of his intention.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas de la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de la yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to him, it is said: “What is right concentration?” and so on.

original: yang dag pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i don dam par chos thams cad la tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad kyis mnyam pa zhes bya ba'i don dam par chos thams cad la tha dad pa med de /
translated: The meaning of “equality in reality” and “equality in all dharmas” is that ultimately all dharmas are undifferentiated.

original: stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing mnyam par sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du ro gcig cing mnyam par sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: The one-pointed placement of the mind, equal and of one taste in emptiness, is called right concentration.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning,

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “The concentration on which one dwells” and so on.

original: sems can thams cad ces bya ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ces bya ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rab tu thar par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate all sentient beings from the afflictive obstructions,🔽one-pointedly places the mind on the suchness that is unchanging because it is pure from the beginning.

original: de kho na ye nas dag pas mi 'gyur ba la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de kho na ye nas dag pas mi 'gyur ba la rtse gcig tu 'jog pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is right concentration.

original: nges par gyur ba las 'jug pa'i don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nges par gyur ba las 'jug pa'i don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'o //
translated: One enters into the ultimate concentration that engages in the definitive.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Among those, right view is the branch of complete discernment,

original: des ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na la gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji ltar myong ba'i de kho na la gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it completely discerns the suchness that is experienced.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right thought is the branch of causing others to understand,

original: des ji ltar khong du chud pa sems la brtags na tshig tu smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ji ltar khong du chud pa sems la brtags na tshig tu smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes others to understand by verbalizing what is ascertained in the mind.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las dang / 'tsho ba gsum ni gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The three—right speech, right action, and right livelihood—are the branches of causing others to have confidence.

original: de dag gis rim pa bzhin du lta ba la sogs rnam par dag pa de la yid ches pas so //
analyzed: de dag gis rim pa bzhin du lta ba la sogs rnam par dag pa de la yid ches pas so //
translated: They respectively purify view, etc. because they are the basis of the purification of view, etc.

original: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ji ltar khong du chud pa dris pa la lung bstan pa'i sgo nas 'di'i lta ba rnam par dag go zhes gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i ngag gis ji ltar khong du chud pa dris pa la lung bstan pa'i sgo nas 'di'i lta ba rnam par dag go zhes gzhan yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, one's view is purified because one is convinced of the purity of one's view through the teaching that is imparted in response to one's questions about what one has understood through right speech.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni mi bya ba mi byed pa dang / 'ong ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni mi bya ba mi byed pa dang / 'ong ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Right action is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the three kinds of nonvirtuous action, such as taking life, etc.

original: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims rnam par dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: spyod pa phun sum tshogs pas tshul khrims rnam par dag par yid ches so //
translated: One is convinced of the purity of morality through the perfection of conduct in coming and going, etc.🔽Right livelihood is the limb of the path that is the antidote to wrong livelihood.🔽One is convinced of the purity of livelihood

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas chos gos la sogs pa chos bzhin du tshol ba'i phyir /🔽'tsho @257a * //🔽ba rnam par dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas chos gos la sogs pa chos bzhin du tshol ba'i phyir / 'tsho @257a * // ba rnam par dag par yid ches so //
translated: through the purity of livelihood that is obtained through seeking robes, etc. in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right effort is the limb of the path that is the antidote to the obscurations of the passions.

original: des kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of the complete abandonment of all the fetters.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Right mindfulness is the branch of purifying the secondary afflictions.

original: des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma ma brjed pas zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan ma ma brjed pas zhum pa dang / rgod pa'i nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that, the signs of serenity and insight are not forgotten, and so there is no occasion for the afflictions of depression and agitation to arise.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can thob pa la sgrib pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni yon tan khyad par can thob pa la sgrib pa sbyong ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: Concentration is the branch of purifying the obscurations to attaining the special qualities.

original: des sgrib pa sbyangs nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sgrib pa sbyangs nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that, having purified the obscurations, one accomplishes the qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: Thus the noble eightfold path has been explained as inexhaustible.

original: // / bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / spros pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / spros pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show the concise and elaborate yogic practices,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhi gnas dang lhag mthong yang mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, the serenity and insight of the bodhisattvas are also inexhaustible.”

original: de gnyis mi zad pa yang de gnyis rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'i chos dang / rtogs par bya ba'i chos mi zad pas na /
analyzed: de gnyis mi zad pa yang de gnyis rtse gcig tu gzhag pa'i chos dang / rtogs par bya ba'i chos mi zad pas na /
translated: The imperishability of those two is the imperishability of the Dharma which is to be realized, and the Dharma which is to be settled one-pointedly.

original: de la rtse gcig tu 'jog par byed pa dang / rtogs par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtse gcig tu 'jog par byed pa dang / rtogs par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the settling one-pointedly and the realization are also imperishable.

original: bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam na zhi gnas la rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni gang sbyor ba dang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam na zhi gnas la rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the yoga of synthesis is one who is engaged in serenity on the path of application, seeing, and cultivation.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him, it is said:

original: de la zhi gnas mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽zhi gnas mi zad pa yang zhi gnas kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / zhi gnas nyid mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // zhi gnas mi zad pa yang zhi gnas kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / zhi gnas nyid mi zad pa ste /
translated: What is the imperishability of serenity?

original: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: The imperishability of serenity should be understood as twofold: the imperishability of the requisites of serenity and the imperishability of serenity itself.

original: de la gang sems zhi ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gang sems zhi ba dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: The imperishability of the requisites of serenity is from the words,🔽“He cultivates the factors of enlightenment in proper order” up to “He is skilled in the methods of serenity and insight.”

original: btang snyoms sgom zhes bya ba yan chad ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: btang snyoms sgom zhes bya ba yan chad ni zhi gnas kyi tshogs so //
translated: The imperishability of serenity is from the words,🔽“He is skilled in the method of serenity” up to “He is skilled in the method of the four noble persons.”

original: bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te dgu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis zhi gnas nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po zhes bya ba nas brtsams te dgu po 'di dag ni zhi gnas zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yan chad kyis zhi gnas nyid bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning The first concentration and ending with these nine are called serenity teaches serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs la rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs la rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: The prerequisites for serenity are twofold:

original: gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i tshogs dang / gtso bo'i tshogs so //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i tshogs dang / gtso bo'i tshogs so //
translated: the prerequisites that are not primary and the primary prerequisites.

original: gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa ma yin pa'i tshogs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the prerequisites that are not primary,🔽it is said:🔽A mind that is calm, very calm,

original: sems zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems zhi ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and completely calm,🔽not scattered outward,🔽but very focused inwardly.

original: nang du sems rnam par rtog pa mi mang ba ni sems zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nang du sems rnam par rtog pa mi mang ba ni sems zhi ba'o //
translated: A mind that is calm is a mind that is not very discursive internally.

original: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rtog par mi dga' ba @257b ni rab tu zhi ba'o //🔽phyi nang gnyis la rtog pa med pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul rnams la rtog par mi dga' ba @257b ni rab tu zhi ba'o // phyi nang gnyis la rtog pa med pa 'am /
translated: A mind that is very calm is a mind that does not delight in discursive thought about external objects.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa med pa ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa med pa ni nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: A mind that is completely calm is a mind that is free of discursive thought about external or internal objects, or a mind that is free of sleepiness and lethargy.

original: nang du sems rnam par rtog pa mi mang ba ste zhi bas na /
analyzed: nang du sems rnam par rtog pa mi mang ba ste zhi bas na /
translated: Since the mind is calm, not very discursive internally,

original: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'o //
translated: it is not distracted.

original: phyi rol du rtog pa med de rab tu zhi bas na /
analyzed: phyi rol du rtog pa med de rab tu zhi bas na /
translated: Since the mind is very calm, not discursive externally,🔽it is very focused inwardly.

original: dbang po legs par bsdoms pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po legs par bsdoms pa'o //
translated: It is to have one’s senses well restrained.

original: phyi nang gnyi gar rtog pa med pas na mi rgod pa dang mi 'phyar ba'o //
analyzed: phyi nang gnyi gar rtog pa med pas na mi rgod pa dang mi 'phyar ba'o //
translated: It is to be neither restless nor agitated, because one does not conceptualize either internally or externally.

original: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa'i gtam mang po la mi 'jug pas na mu cor mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang rkun po la sogs pa'i gtam mang po la mi 'jug pas na mu cor mi smra ba'o //
translated: It is to not speak nonsense, because one does not engage in many conversations with kings, thieves, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas na yab yab po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang du mi 'gyur bas na yab yab po ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is to not be unsteady, because one is not under the power of the afflictions.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pas na mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is to be unmoving, because one cannot be shaken by the discordant factors of concentration.

original: gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug cing zhe sdang ba'i sems med pas na zhi des so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug cing zhe sdang ba'i sems med pas na zhi des so //
translated: It is to be peaceful and gentle, because one does not follow others and has no hateful thoughts.

original: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug par sdom pas na bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dbang po'i yul la mi 'jug par sdom pas na bsrungs pa'o //
translated: It is to be guarded, because one restrains the eyes and the other senses from engaging with their objects.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs pas na cang shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam la zhugs pas na cang shes pa'o //
translated: It is to be skilled, because one has entered the path of abandoning the afflictions.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa med pas na las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa med pas na las su rung ba'o //
translated: It is to be workable, because one is free from sleep and torpor.

original: dmigs pa'i yul la sems gzhan du mi 'gro bas na rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i yul la sems gzhan du mi 'gro bas na rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: It is to be one-pointed, because one’s mind does not go elsewhere with regard to the object of meditation.

original: gcig pur gnas par mos pas na mos pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pur gnas par mos pas na mos pa'o //
translated: It is interest, because one is interested in living alone.

original: 'gro ba mang po dang lhan cig mi gnas pas na 'du 'dzi yongs su spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po dang lhan cig mi gnas pas na 'du 'dzi yongs su spong ba'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of crowds, because one does not live with many people.

original: sems rtse gcig pa la mos pa'i phyir dben par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa la mos pa'i phyir dben par dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the delight in solitude, because one is interested in onepointedness of mind.

original: gcig pu dga' zhing 'du 'dzin spong bas na lus dben pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu dga' zhing 'du 'dzin spong bas na lus dben pa'o //
translated: It is the solitude of the body, because one delights in solitude and avoids crowds.

original: nyon mongs pas sems dkrugs pa med pas na sems ma bslad pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas sems dkrugs pa med pas na sems ma bslad pa'o //
translated: It is the unsullied mind, because the mind is not disturbed by the afflictions.

original: ri dang brag phug la sogs par gnas par sems mngon par 'du byed pas na dgon par mngon du phyogs par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: ri dang brag phug la sogs par gnas par sems mngon par 'du byed pas na dgon par mngon du phyogs par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention directed toward solitude, because one forms the thought to live in a place such as a mountain cave.

original: chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa nyi tshe tsam 'chang bas na 'dod pa nyung ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa nyi tshe tsam 'chang bas na 'dod pa nyung ba'o //
translated: It is fewness of wishes, because one has only a few possessions such as robes and almsbowl.

original: de las lhag par mi 'dod pas na 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par mi 'dod pas na 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: It is contentment, because one does not wish for more than that.

original: ngan pas chog par 'dzin pas na 'dod chen med pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pas chog par 'dzin pas na 'dod chen med pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of great desires, because one is satisfied with what is poor.

original: bzang po mi tshol bas na chog shes pa'o //
analyzed: bzang po mi tshol bas na chog shes pa'o //
translated: It is satisfaction, because one does not seek what is better.

original: log pa'i 'tsho ba med pas na 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i 'tsho ba med pas na 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the purification of livelihood, because one does not have wrong livelihood.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pas na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pas na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: And perfect ritual means pure morality.

original: spyod lam thams cad du nyon mongs pa mi skya zhing spyod lam mdzes pas spyod lam bsrungs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad du nyon mongs pa mi skya zhing spyod lam mdzes pas spyod lam bsrungs pa'o //
translated: And guarding behavior means that in all postures, afflictions do not arise, and one's behavior is attractive.

original: dus dang tshod dang / dus min shes pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du lta'o //
analyzed: dus dang tshod dang / dus min shes pa ni sngar bshad pa bzhin du lta'o //
translated: As for knowing the right time and the occasion, this should be understood as explained above.

original: kha zas mang du yang mi za nyung du yang mi za ste ran par byed pas na ran drod shes pa'o //🔽cung zad tsam gyis chog @258a * //
analyzed: kha zas mang du yang mi za nyung du yang mi za ste ran par byed pas na ran drod shes pa'o // cung zad tsam gyis chog @258a * //
translated: And knowing the right amount means that one eats neither too much nor too little, and so one is moderate.

original: shes par 'dzin pas na dgang sla ba dang / gso sla ba'o //
analyzed: shes par 'dzin pas na dgang sla ba dang / gso sla ba'o //
translated: And easy to satisfy means that one is satisfied with just a little.🔽And easy to fill means that one is satisfied with just a little.

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis mi mtho mi dma' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis mi mtho mi dma' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for not high-flown and not low, through the power of discernment.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi mthus /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyi mthus /
translated: By the power of wisdom endowed with concentration,

original: chos rnams ji yang ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir bstod pa la sogs pas mtho bar yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos rnams ji yang ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir bstod pa la sogs pas mtho bar yang mi 'gyur /
translated: one realizes that all things are not real, and so one is not made high by praise, etc.,

original: smad pa la sogs pas dmas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa la sogs pas dmas par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: nor is one made low by contempt, etc.

original: ngan du brjod pa ni sngon 'das pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: ngan du brjod pa ni sngon 'das pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The evil speech is in the past.

original: ngan du smras pa ni da ltar gyi dus nyid na'o //🔽gtso bo'i tshogs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan du smras pa ni da ltar gyi dus nyid na'o // gtso bo'i tshogs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The evil talk is in the present.

original: rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs ba'i sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to teach the principal assembly, he says, the generation of the mind which is directed toward yoga, etc.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i sems bskyed pa ni rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i sems bskyed pa ni rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The generation of the mind which cultivates calm and insight is the generation of the mind which is directed toward yoga.

original: yang dag 'jog la mngon par dga' zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mos pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag 'jog la mngon par dga' zhes bya ba ni de nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa la mos pa'o //
translated: The phrase, he delights in perfect placement, means that he is devoted to the cultivation of that very concentration.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag rtog dpyod dang bcas pa dang / rtog dpyod med pa la sogs pa bsgom pa snga nas yid la byed cing rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yan lag rtog dpyod dang bcas pa dang / rtog dpyod med pa la sogs pa bsgom pa snga nas yid la byed cing rtsom pa'o //
translated: The phrase, he attends to the factors of meditative concentration, means that he cultivates the factors of meditative concentration, such as investigation and analysis, etc., and he attends to the cultivation of the factors of meditative concentration, such as the absence of investigation and analysis, etc.

original: byams pa bskyed pa dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsa bar gyur pa tshad med pa gnyis snga nas skyed cing sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa bskyed pa dang / snying rje mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsa bar gyur pa tshad med pa gnyis snga nas skyed cing sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The line generating loving kindness and accomplishing compassion means that one previously generates and accomplishes the two immeasurables that are the root of samādhi.

original: dga' ba la gzhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrug par byed pa dga' ba tshad med pa la sems gzhog cing btang snyoms tshad med pa bsgom la /
analyzed: dga' ba la gzhog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin mi 'khrug par byed pa dga' ba tshad med pa la sems gzhog cing btang snyoms tshad med pa bsgom la /
translated: The line settling in joy and so on means that one settles the mind in immeasurable joy, which prevents the disturbance of samādhi, and cultivates immeasurable equanimity.

original: de gnyis kyi sems dang rtag par ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi sems dang rtag par ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: One is always endowed with the mind of those two.

original: zhi gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi gnas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach śamatha, [the pāramitā sūtras] say,

original: bsam gtan dang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the first concentration and so on.

original: mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag gi don ni sngar bshad par zad do //🔽zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag gi don ni sngar bshad par zad do // zhi gnas kyi tshogs ni tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The meaning of these sequential samāpattis has already been explained.

original: zhi gnas bsgom pa'i rgyu'i chos nam mkha' dang 'dra bar tshad med de /
analyzed: zhi gnas bsgom pa'i rgyu'i chos nam mkha' dang 'dra bar tshad med de /
translated: The line the accumulation of śamatha is immeasurable and so on means that the phenomena that are the causes for cultivating śamatha are immeasurable like space.

original: zhi gnas kyi tshogs de dag la gang brtson pa rnams kyang zhi gnas tshad med par skye bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi tshogs de dag la gang brtson pa rnams kyang zhi gnas tshad med par skye bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Those who strive for the accumulations of serenity will generate immeasurable serenity.

original: zhi gnas mi zad pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhi gnas mi zad pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “inexhaustible serenity.”

original: spros pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: spros pa'i rnal 'byor la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattva who has entered the yoga of elaboration

original: gang lam de dag nyid na lhag mthong la rab tu sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gang lam de dag nyid na lhag mthong la rab tu sbyor ba ste /
translated: is one who is engaged in insight on those very paths.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of that,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @258b pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag mthong mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs @258b pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, “What is the bodhisattvas’ inexhaustible insight?” and so on.

original: gang shes rab kyi cha dang mthun par bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi cha dang mthun par bsgom pa'i lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: It says, “What is the path of meditation that is compatible with wisdom?”

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Insight has the nature of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi cha dang phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos la goms par byed pa thams cad lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi cha dang phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos la goms par byed pa thams cad lhag mthong zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, all the cultivation of phenomena that are included in the category of wisdom is called “insight.”

original: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams la g-yo ba med par shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge that phenomena are unmoving

original: chos thams cad la byed pa po med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la byed pa po med par shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge that all phenomena are devoid of an agent.

original: gong du bshad pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa rnams ni 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The above explanations are not repeated here.

original: bden pa rnams la shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa rnams la /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa rnams la /
translated: The knowledge called “seeing the thorough understanding of the truths” is the knowledge that sees the truths of suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: bden pa so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mthong ba ni /
analyzed: bden pa so so'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa phyin ci ma log par rtogs shing mthong ba ni /
translated: The unerring understanding and seeing of the characteristics of each truth

original: shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la /🔽chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar mthong ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs par mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la / chos thams cad rgyu dang rkyen las skye bar mthong ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang mi 'gal bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: is called “the knowledge that sees thorough understanding.”

original: lta ba thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge called “seeing the non-contradiction of dependent origination” is the knowledge that sees all phenomena as arising from causes and conditions, without contradicting dependent origination.🔽The knowledge called “seeing the non-contradiction of all views” is the knowledge that sees all views as not contradicting the Dharma.

original: chos thams cad rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / bdag dang / sems can med par mthong ba ni lta ba thams cad dang bral bar mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la /🔽rgyu gang bskrun na 'bras bu de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ba dang / las gang byas na rnam par smin pa de bzhin du myong bar 'gyur ba mthong ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / bdag dang / sems can med par mthong ba ni lta ba thams cad dang bral bar mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o // rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba la / rgyu gang bskrun na 'bras bu de bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ba dang / las gang byas na rnam par smin pa de bzhin du myong bar 'gyur ba mthong ba ni /
translated: Seeing all phenomena as permanent, as impermanent, as having a self, and as having no self is called the cognition of seeing free from all views.🔽🔽As for what is called cause and effect,🔽seeing that whatever cause is produced, the effect arises in the same way, and that whatever action is done, the ripening is experienced in the same way,🔽

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //🔽'bras bu thob pa zhes bya ba la /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i 'bras bu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed cing khong du chud do zhes mthong ba ni /🔽'bras bu thob pa mngon sum du bya ba la rtog par mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang rnam par smin pa chud mi za bar mthong ba'i shes pa'o //🔽'bras bu thob pa zhes bya ba la /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i 'bras bu mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed cing khong du chud do zhes mthong ba ni /🔽'bras bu thob pa mngon sum du bya ba la rtog par mthong ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The vision that all things are impermanent, that they are neither permanent nor annihilated, that they are neither identical nor different, that they are neither produced nor extinguished, that they are neither increased nor diminished, that they are neither pure nor impure, that they are neither defiled nor undefiled, that they are neither appropriated nor not appropriated, that they form, that they are neither with afflictions nor without afflictions, that they are neither with outflows nor without outflows, that they are neither with hindrances nor without hindrances, that they are neither with thoughts nor without thoughts, that they are neither with characteristics nor without characteristics, that they are neither with signs nor without signs, that they are neither with practice nor without practice, that they are neither with attainments nor without attainments, that they are neither with wisdom nor without wisdom, that they are neither with knowledge nor without with the world system of the present nor not with the world system of the present, that

original: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa ni ye shes te /
translated: The entry into reality is intuition.

original: ye shes kyis stong pa nyid rtogs so zhes mthong ba ni /
analyzed: ye shes kyis stong pa nyid rtogs so zhes mthong ba ni /
translated: The vision that one realizes emptiness by means of intuition

original: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the knowledge that sees the entry into reality.

original: lhag mthong gi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other synonyms of profound insight,

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yang dag par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni chos rnams yang dag par mthong ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Profound insight is the correct vision of things.”

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du chos thams cad la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid du chos thams cad la phyin ci ma log par mthong ba ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The unerring vision of all things as having the character of the selflessness of persons and things is profound insight.

original: chos rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: “The vision of things as they are” means

original: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / @259a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / @259a * //
translated: that all things are like a magical creation or a mirage.

original: smig rgyu tsam du ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu tsam du ji ltar snang ba de bzhin du yod par mthong ba'o //
translated: One sees them as they appear on the covering level of the truth.

original: chos rnams de kho na nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'o //🔽chos rnams gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig de kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: chos rnams de kho na nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba'o // chos rnams gzhan ma yin pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig de kho na yin gyi /
translated: The phrase one sees phenomena as they are in reality means that one sees phenomena such as the aggregates as having a nature that is unchanging like space.

original: de las de kho na gzhan med par mthong ba'o //🔽ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par dag pa dang / dben par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de las de kho na gzhan med par mthong ba'o // ji lta ba bzhin dang / rnam par dag pa dang / dben par mthong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one sees phenomena as not other means that one sees that emptiness alone is reality, and that there is no reality other than that.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa yin par mthong ba'o ;
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pas stong pa yin par mthong ba'o ;
translated: The phrase one sees phenomena as they are, as pure, and as secluded means that one sees all phenomena as being naturally radiant and as being empty of the aspects of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: / rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rnam grangs gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other synonyms,🔽the root text says,

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “Insight is also called ‘seeing the characteristics of phenomena’ and ‘seeing the truth.’ ”

original: yod pa'i rnam pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo yang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i rnam pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i rang bzhin dang ngo bo yang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: “Nor does he see the aspect of existence” means that he does not see the nature and essence of existence.

original: med pa'i rnam pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin dang ngo bor yang mi mthong ba'o ;🔽/ dmigs pa dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: med pa'i rnam pa yang mi mthong zhes bya ba ni med pa'i rang bzhin dang ngo bor yang mi mthong ba'o ; / dmigs pa dang mtshan ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Nor does he see the aspect of nonexistence” means that he does not see the nature and essence of nonexistence.🔽“Objective supports and signs” means that he does not see the nature of objective supports such as form, sound, etc.,

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin yin par yang mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / dkar po dang dmar po la sogs pa'i mtshan ma'i rang bzhin yin par yang mi mthong ba'o //
translated: or the nature of signs such as white, red, etc.

original: de mthong mod kyi ci yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de mthong mod kyi ci yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He does see, but he does not see anything” means that

original: lhag mthong dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gong du ming gis smos pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul du mthong mod kyi dmigs pa dang / yod pa'i rnam pa rdul tsam yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gong du ming gis smos pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul du mthong mod kyi dmigs pa dang / yod pa'i rnam pa rdul tsam yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the bodhisattva who possesses insight does see the things mentioned above, but he does not see even an atom of objective supports or the aspect of existence.

original: gang gi tshe mthong ba med pa de'i tshe mthong ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthong ba med pa de'i tshe mthong ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one does not see, then one sees.

original: de ltar ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de ltar ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: Thus, one does not apprehend anything.

original: don dam par ci yang ma mthong ba ni ;
analyzed: don dam par ci yang ma mthong ba ni ;
translated: Not seeing anything ultimately,🔽one sees and realizes reality.

original: chos nyid mthong zhing rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos nyid mthong zhing rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: lhag mthong gis kyang mthong ba ma yin /
analyzed: lhag mthong gis kyang mthong ba ma yin /
translated: Nor does one see by means of insight.🔽One sees that one does not see.

original: ma mthong ba yang ma yin par mthong zhes bya ba ni nam stong par mthong ba'i dus na dngos po rdul tsam yang ma mthong bas mthong ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yang ma yin par mthong zhes bya ba ni nam stong par mthong ba'i dus na dngos po rdul tsam yang ma mthong bas mthong ba yang ma yin /
translated: When one sees emptiness, one does not see even an atom of substance, so one does not see.

original: de kho na mthong bas na ma mthong ba yang ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de kho na mthong bas na ma mthong ba yang ma yin pa 'am /
translated: But because one sees reality, one does not not see.

original: don dam par dngos po gang yang ma mthong bas na /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po gang yang ma mthong bas na /
translated: Or, ultimately, one does not see any substance at all,

original: mthong ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma yin la /
translated: so one does not see.

original: kun rdzob tu btags pa tsam du mthong bas na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu btags pa tsam du mthong bas na /
translated: But because one sees that things are merely conceptualized in the conventional sense,

original: ma mthong ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: one does not not see.

original: yang dag pa nyad ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyad ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Reality is the unmistaken characteristic of things.

original: lhag mthong la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos @259b rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i lhag mthong thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni chos @259b rnams kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i lhag mthong thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes skilled in insight. This means that one attains insight skilled in the characteristics of things.

original: de ltar mthong yang mngon par 'du mi byed par mi ltung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar mthong yang mngon par 'du mi byed par mi ltung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One sees thus, yet does not fall into the extreme of non-performance.

original: don dam par gong du bshad pa lta bur chos rnams mi dmigs par mthong yang stong pa nyid kyi mthar yang mi ltung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par gong du bshad pa lta bur chos rnams mi dmigs par mthong yang stong pa nyid kyi mthar yang mi ltung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one sees things as non-apprehensible in the ultimate, as explained above, yet does not fall into the extreme of emptiness.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang mi ldang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu las dang 'bras bu yod par lta bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du byed pa las kyang mi ldang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu las dang 'bras bu yod par lta bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa yang mi gtong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One does not rise from the performance of the roots of virtue. This means that one does not abandon the performance of the accumulations of merit and wisdom, by seeing the conventional existence of action and effect.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The imperishability of serenity and insight has been explained.

original: // / so sor rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / so sor rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the bodhisattvas who are individually released, it says:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, etc.

original: 'di gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don lung bstan pa thob par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi bsdus pa'i don lung bstan pa thob par bstan to //
translated: The meaning of these two is taught in the prediction.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa gnyis mi zad par yang gzungs kyis dran par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / spobs pas rtogs par bya zhing bshad par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas na dran par byed pa dang / 'chad par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa gnyis mi zad par yang gzungs kyis dran par bya ba'i chos rnams dang / spobs pas rtogs par bya zhing bshad par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pas na dran par byed pa dang / 'chad par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: The two, retention and eloquence, are also inexhaustible, because the teachings to be remembered by retention and the teachings to be understood and explained by eloquence are inexhaustible, so the one who remembers and the one who explains are also inexhaustible.

original: so sor rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: so sor rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattvas who are individually their supports are also of two kinds.

original: thos pa mi brjed pa dang / ma thos pa 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa mi brjed pa dang / ma thos pa 'dod pa'o //
translated: They are the one who does not forget what is heard and the one who desires what is not heard.

original: thos pa mi brjed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thos pa mi brjed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one who does not forget what is heard?

original: gang gsungs pa so sor thob pa ste /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa so sor thob pa ste /
translated: It is the attainment of what is taught.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that as the basis,

original: de la gzungs ni mi brjed pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la gzungs ni mi brjed pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What is retention that does not forget?” and so on.

original: de yang gang gis mi brjed pa dang / gang mi brjed pa dang / mi brjed pa nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gang gis mi brjed pa dang / gang mi brjed pa dang / mi brjed pa nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, it is not forgetting, not forgetting something, and not forgetting something without loss.

original: de la gang gis mi brjed pa ni /
