analyzed: de la gang gis mi brjed pa ni /
translated: Here, not forgetting is

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba nas bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba nas bstan to //
translated: the accumulation of the roots of virtue.

original: gang mi brjed pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang mi brjed pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Not forgetting something is the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma.

original: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni gzungs zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: This is called dhāraṇī.

original: mi brjed pa nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni /🔽gang gi tshe bskal pa gzhan gyi rjes zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mi brjed pa nyams par mi 'gyur ba ni / gang gi tshe bskal pa gzhan gyi rjes zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Not forgetting something without loss is

original: skyu ru ra'i 'bru 'dug pa bzhin du mthong zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
analyzed: skyu ru ra'i 'bru 'dug pa bzhin du mthong zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bstan to //
translated: when, in another eon, one sees the Buddha's form as if it were a myrobalan fruit.

original: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'i dus na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i dran pas so //
analyzed: sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa'i dran pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma'i dus na bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i dran pas so //
translated: The accumulation of the roots of virtue is the memory that arises from the cause of accumulating the collections of merit and wisdom in former lifetimes.

original: 'dzin pa ni yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni yi ge rnams so //
translated: The letters are the retention of the words.

original: kun 'dzin pa ni don rnams so //
analyzed: kun 'dzin pa ni don rnams so //
translated: The meanings are the retention of the meanings.

original: mi brjed pa ni phyis kyang yi ge mi brjed par byed ba'o //🔽dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa ni phyis kyang don @260a * //
analyzed: mi brjed pa ni phyis kyang yi ge mi brjed par byed ba'o // dran pas yang dag par 'dzin pa ni phyis kyang don @260a * //
translated: The non-forgetting is the non-forgetting of the letters later on.

original: mi brjed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi brjed par byed pa ste /
translated: The retention by mindfulness is the non-forgetting of the meanings later on.

original: de dag gis ni gzungs kyi gsung rab 'jig rten du bshad de gzhag pa rnams mi brjed par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gzungs kyi gsung rab 'jig rten du bshad de gzhag pa rnams mi brjed par byed pa bstan to //
translated: These indicate the retention of the teachings of the scriptures that have been explained and set forth in the world, and the non-forgetting of them.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phral du gsungs pa'i don dang / tshig mi brjed par byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'phral du gsungs pa'i don dang / tshig mi brjed par byed pa bstan to //
translated: The all-knowing and so on indicate the non-forgetting of the meanings and words that are being spoken at the moment.

original: chud za bar mi 'gyur ba ni chos dang don dran pa'i ye shes de med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chud za bar mi 'gyur ba ni chos dang don dran pa'i ye shes de med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The non-loss is the non-disappearance of the knowledge of the Dharma and its meanings.

original: brjed par yang mi 'gyur ba ni kha cig dran pa kha cig mi dran pa ste /
analyzed: brjed par yang mi 'gyur ba ni kha cig dran pa kha cig mi dran pa ste /
translated: The non-forgetting is the non-forgetting of some and the forgetting of other things.

original: dran pa dri ma can du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dri ma can du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the non-defiled mindfulness.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mig dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mig dang 'dra bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase with the eye of noble wisdom means that it is like the eye of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: ma thos pa 'dod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma thos pa 'dod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the desire to hear what has not been heard?

original: gang spobs pa so sor thob pa ste /🔽de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang spobs pa so sor thob pa ste / de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: It is the attainment of eloquence.🔽With reference to that, it is said:

original: de la spobs pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la spobs pa mi zad pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What is inexhaustibility of eloquence?

original: gang la yang brten mi dgos par bstan pas na /
analyzed: gang la yang brten mi dgos par bstan pas na /
translated: Since it is taught that one does not need to rely on anything else,

original: thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa'o //
translated: it is unobstructed eloquence.

original: bskal pa'am de las lhag par yang ston pas na rgyun chad med par spobs pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa'am de las lhag par yang ston pas na rgyun chad med par spobs pa'o //
translated: Since it is taught for eons or more, it is uninterrupted eloquence.

original: bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing nams kyang nyams par 'gyur ba med pas mi 'phrogs pa'i spongs ba'o //
analyzed: bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pas zil gyis mi non cing nams kyang nyams par 'gyur ba med pas mi 'phrogs pa'i spongs ba'o //
translated: Since it is not overwhelmed by demons, non-Buddhists, and so on, and never degenerates, it is unassailable eloquence.

original: chos dang don mi brjed pas na ma rmongs pa'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang don mi brjed pas na ma rmongs pa'i spobs pa'o //
translated: Since it is not confused about the Dharma and its meaning, it is undeluded eloquence.

original: dris pa rnams la lan glon pas na myur ba'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: dris pa rnams la lan glon pas na myur ba'i spobs pa'o //
translated: Since it answers questions, it is swift eloquence.

original: gang dang gang bstan pa rnams kyis sems kyi dbang po la dga' ba skyed par byed pas na dga' ba'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang bstan pa rnams kyis sems kyi dbang po la dga' ba skyed par byed pas na dga' ba'i spobs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence that delights is so called because it delights the mental faculty of the listener by whatever is taught.

original: gzhan dag zil gyis gnon par byed pas na la gor du spobs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag zil gyis gnon par byed pas na la gor du spobs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence that is overwhelming is so called because it overwhelms others.

original: ji ltar khas blangs pa las bsgyur te gzhan du 'chad par byed pas na mi 'gyur ba'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar khas blangs pa las bsgyur te gzhan du 'chad par byed pas na mi 'gyur ba'i spobs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence that is uninterrupted is so called because it explains without altering what was accepted previously.

original: chos kyi don myur du rtogs pas na rno ba'i spobs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi don myur du rtogs pas na rno ba'i spobs pa'o //
translated: Eloquence that is sharp is so called because it quickly understands the meaning of the teaching.

original: zab mo'i don rtogs par byed pas na mgyogs pa'i spobs pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i don rtogs par byed pas na mgyogs pa'i spobs pa ste /
translated: Eloquence that is quick is so called because it causes the profound meaning to be understood.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spobs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s eloquence.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' de'i 'o //
translated: “That” refers to the bodhisattva.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i spobs pa de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i spobs pa de'o //
translated: “That” refers to the eloquence explained above.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pas de'i shes rab kyis rang bzhin spobs pa de yang yongs su dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang / ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pas de'i shes rab kyis rang bzhin spobs pa de yang yongs su dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Purified by the maturation of karma” means that by the purity of his physical, verbal, and mental actions, his naturally eloquent wisdom is also purified.

original: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus bstangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus bstangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Blessed by the Buddha” means that he is sustained by the power of the Buddha.

original: lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / bshad pa la sogs @260b pa rdzogs shing ma lus par ston pa 'am zur chag cing nyams pa med par ston nus pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis yongs su bzung ba zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i lan gdab pa dang / bshad pa la sogs @260b pa rdzogs shing ma lus par ston pa 'am zur chag cing nyams pa med par ston nus pa'o //
translated: “Cared for by the gods” means that he is able to teach the answers to questions completely and without error, or without omissions or mistakes.

original: 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni don gang dang gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod par chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni don gang dang gang gi phyir /
translated: “He teaches the Dharma that has results” means that whatever the purpose of his teaching the Dharma,

original: chos bstan pa'i don de dang de dag de bzhin du yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i don de dang de dag de bzhin du yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: those purposes will be accomplished just as they are.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gro zhes bya ba ni spobs pas chos bshad pa rnams//
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du 'gro zhes bya ba ni spobs pas chos bshad pa rnams//
translated: The path to nirvana is the path that leads to nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam dang mthun par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The path that leads to nirvana is the path that is in accord with the attainment of nirvana.

original: des zhes bya ba ni spobs pa rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni spobs pa rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'o //
translated: He, the bodhisattva, is endowed with pure eloquence.

original: de ltar spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bur na spobs pa mthar phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa lta bur na spobs pa mthar phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, he is endowed with perfect eloquence. The meaning is that he has perfected eloquence as explained above.

original: gzugs su snang ba ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs su snang ba'i chos ji snyed pa rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par sun 'byin pa dang / chos de dag gi mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad de sbyar te bstan par nus pa'i shes rab kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs su snang ba ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs su snang ba'i chos ji snyed pa rnams mi rtag pa la sogs par sun 'byin pa dang / chos de dag gi mtshan nyid tshigs su bcad de sbyar te bstan par nus pa'i shes rab kyang de snyed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As many as are the appearances of form, i.e., as many as are the phenomena that appear as form, he has that many kinds of wisdom for repudiating their impermanence, etc. The characteristics of those phenomena are taught in the verse.

original: de bzhin du sgra la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to sound.

original: de dang der zhes bya ba ni 'khor de dang de dag tu'o //
analyzed: de dang der zhes bya ba ni 'khor de dang de dag tu'o //
translated: “In this and that” means in this and that assembly.

original: de'i lhun gyis grub pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i lhun gyis grub pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In this and that assembly” means in this and that retinue.🔽“Spontaneously” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pa rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pa rtsol ba dang 'bad pa med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: without the bodhisattva’s effort or exertion.

original: dad pa ni de dag ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa ni de dag ji ltar 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Faith” means according to their desires.

original: dbang po rnams ni dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / tha ma rnams so //
translated: “Faculties” means sharp, middling, and dull.

original: chos spobs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / dbang po dang mthun mthun du chos ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos spobs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang / dbang po dang mthun mthun du chos ston par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “He teaches the Dharma” means he teaches the Dharma in accordance with their faith and faculties.

original: de 'dod na tshe gzhan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de 'dod na tshe gzhan ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: “If he wishes, in another life” and so on.

original: spobs pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gal te bdag nyid 'dod na tshe du ma dang / bskal pa du ma 'das kyi bar du yang 'dug pa'i spyod lam las mi ldang zhing bsam mi dgos par chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spobs pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gal te bdag nyid 'dod na tshe du ma dang / bskal pa du ma 'das kyi bar du yang 'dug pa'i spyod lam las mi ldang zhing bsam mi dgos par chos ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If that bodhisattva who has inexhaustible eloquence wishes to, he can remain in the same posture for many lives and many eons without rising and without thinking, he teaches the Dharma.

original: de'i chos bstan pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pas chos bstan pa des kyang sems can rnams sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i chos bstan pa des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / byang chub sems dpa' de'i spobs pas chos bstan pa des kyang sems can rnams sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: And by that teaching of the Dharma by that bodhisattva's eloquence,🔽sentient beings are liberated in order to completely extinguish suffering.

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur te de bzhin du sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par byed nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And by that teaching of the Dharma by that bodhisattva's eloquence, sentient beings are liberated in order to completely extinguish suffering.

original: gzungs dang spobs pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gzungs dang spobs pa mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The inexhaustible dhāraṇī and eloquence have been explained.

original: // / ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / zhi pa'i nga rgyal med pa ste /
analyzed: // / ston pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'du byed thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa dang / zhi pa'i nga rgyal med pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva teacher is one who knows the characteristics of all conditioned things, who knows the characteristics of all that is defiled, who knows the characteristics of all things, and who is free of the pride of peace.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to him,

original: @261a * // btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi mdo bzhi mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @261a * // btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi mdo bzhi mi zad pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text says, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, there are also four summaries of the Dharma that are inexhaustible for the bodhisattvas.”

original: de dag gi bsdus pa'i don de thob par rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //🔽chos kyi mdo zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'di bzhi mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi bsdus pa'i don de thob par rnam par gzhag pa bstan to // chos kyi mdo zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'di bzhi mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The concise meaning of those is presented in the explanation.

original: chos kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mdo zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “summary of the Dharma” is used because these four—impermanence and so on—are taught in brief as summaries of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: mi zad pa ni des bsdu par bya ba'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos zad mi shes pas na mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa ni des bsdu par bya ba'i 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos zad mi shes pas na mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Inexhaustible means that the conditioned and unconditioned phenomena included in that are inexhaustible.

original: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste /🔽bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dir yang bstan pa dang bshad pa'i tshul du rig par bya ste / bzhi gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, it should be understood in the manner of teaching and explanation.🔽What are the four? It begins with Thus have I heard and ends with the knowledge of inexhaustibility enters.

original: mi zad pa'i shes ba rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i shes ba rab tu 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba yan chad ni bstan pa'i tshul lo //
translated: This is the manner of teaching.

original: de man chad lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //🔽'du byed thams cad mi rtag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa mi zad pa'i shes pa rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de man chad lhag ma rnams ni bshad pa'i tshul lo // 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa mi zad pa'i shes pa rab tu 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rest below that is the manner of explanation.🔽The knowledge of inexhaustibility enters when bodhisattvas teach that all formations are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstan pa'i shes pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: The knowledge that arises when bodhisattvas teach that all formations are impermanent is inexhaustible.

original: mi zad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi zad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of inexhaustible.

original: de mi zad pa yang 'du byed kyi chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi zad pa yang 'du byed kyi chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir /
translated: That inexhaustibility is because the phenomena of formations are inexhaustible.

original: de bstan pa 'am shes pa yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de bstan pa 'am shes pa yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: The teaching or knowledge of that is also inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'og ma rnams la yang sbyar ro //
translated: Similarly, the following should be applied to the other topics such as suffering.

original: 'du byed thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de la mi rtag pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de la mi rtag pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to the teaching of the knowledge of the characteristics of all conditioned things, it is said: “What is the meaning of impermanence?” and so on.

original: mi rtag pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of impermanence is also twofold:

original: med pa'i don dang / 'jig pa'i don to //
analyzed: med pa'i don dang / 'jig pa'i don to //
translated: the meaning of non-existence and the meaning of destruction.

original: 'dir ni chos thams cad stong pa yin par dgongs pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni chos thams cad stong pa yin par dgongs pas /
translated: Here, since it is intended that all phenomena are empty,

original: med pa'i don la mi rtag pa'i don du dgongs kyi 'jig pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i don la mi rtag pa'i don du dgongs kyi 'jig pa'i don du ni ma yin te /
translated: the meaning of non-existence is intended as the meaning of impermanence, not the meaning of destruction.

original: de bas na med pa'i don dang mi chags pa'i don te /
analyzed: de bas na med pa'i don dang mi chags pa'i don te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the meaning of non-existence is the meaning of non-attachment,

original: dngos po rnam par 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: but not the meaning of the destruction of things.

original: de la med pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de la med pa'i don ni /
translated: Here, the meaning of non-existence is

original: don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun brtags kyi chos gang yang rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun brtags kyi chos gang yang rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa ste /
translated: Because ultimately, the phenomena of the imagined, which are the apprehended object and apprehending subject, never exist, they are non-existent.

original: de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of impermanence.

original: mi chags pa'i don ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa chags bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang med pa'i phyir mi chags pa ste /
analyzed: mi chags pa'i don ni bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa chags bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po gang yang med pa'i phyir mi chags pa ste /
translated: The meaning of non-attachment is that there is nothing whatsoever that is a thing that one could become attached to, such as “self” and “mine.”

original: de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of non-attachment.

original: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes dngos su gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po 'jig pa'i don ni ma yin no zhes dngos su gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is explicitly stated that the meaning is not the destruction of things.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mi rtag par grags pa dang / dngos po yod pa las zhig ste me dpar 'gyur ba las mi rtag ces bya ba @261b ma yin gyi ye nas rang bzhin gyis rtag pa med pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mi rtag par grags pa dang / dngos po yod pa las zhig ste me dpar 'gyur ba las mi rtag ces bya ba @261b ma yin gyi ye nas rang bzhin gyis rtag pa med pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not that things that are known in the world to be impermanent are impermanent because they are destroyed, that is, cease, having existed. Rather, that which is primordially, by nature, not permanent is called “impermanent.”

original: don de nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i don ni chos la bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don de nyid gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i don ni chos la bdag med ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just what that meaning is, he says, “The meaning of impermanence is the selflessness of phenomena,” and so on.

original: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ngo bo med pa nyid mi rtag pa'i don te chos la bdag med pa de rtag tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir stong pa de la 'jig pa gang yang med de gang
analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i chos rnams la ngo bo med pa nyid mi rtag pa'i don te chos la bdag med pa de rtag tu gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir stong pa de la 'jig pa gang yang med de gang
translated: The meaning of impermanence is the essencelessness of phenomena such as the aggregates and elements, because that selflessness of phenomena is always empty of the nature of grasped and grasper.

original: 'jig pa med cing rtag tu stong pa de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig pa med cing rtag tu stong pa de ni mi rtag pa'i don to //
translated: That which is not destroyed and is always empty has the meaning of impermanence.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de la sdug bsngal gyi don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de la sdug bsngal gyi don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: With reference to the teaching of the knowledge of the characteristics of all that is contaminated, it is said, “What is the meaning of suffering?” and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi don kyang rnam pa lnga ste dga' ba las bzlog pa'i don dang dga' ba dang bral ba'i don dang / dga' ba'i yul ma yin pa'i don dang / sgra tsam du zad pa'i don dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi don kyang rnam pa lnga ste dga' ba las bzlog pa'i don dang dga' ba dang bral ba'i don dang / dga' ba'i yul ma yin pa'i don dang / sgra tsam du zad pa'i don dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of suffering is also fivefold: the meaning of the opposite of joy, the meaning of the absence of joy, the meaning of the absence of a delightful object, the meaning of mere sound, and the meaning of emptiness by nature.

original: de la dga' ba med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya bas dga' ba las bzlog pa'i don rnam par bstan te /
analyzed: de la dga' ba med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya bas dga' ba las bzlog pa'i don rnam par bstan te /
translated: The meaning of “absence of delight” is the meaning of suffering. This shows the meaning of the opposite of delight.

original: sdug bsngal ni dga' ba las bzlog pa ste gang dga' ba 'am chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med cing de las bzlog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni dga' ba las bzlog pa ste gang dga' ba 'am chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med cing de las bzlog pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: Suffering is the opposite of delight. The meaning of the opposite of that is the meaning of suffering.

original: dga' ba zad pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya bas dga' ba dang bral ba'i don bstan te /
analyzed: dga' ba zad pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya bas dga' ba dang bral ba'i don bstan te /
translated: The meaning of “exhaustion of delight” is the meaning of suffering. This shows the meaning of separation from delight.

original: dga' ba'i yul dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal skye bas dga' ba dang chags pa rnams dang bral ba'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yul dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal skye bas dga' ba dang chags pa rnams dang bral ba'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: Separation from the object of delight is the arising of suffering. The meaning of separation from delight and attachment is the meaning of suffering.

original: smon pa med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya ba dga' ba'i yul ma yin pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i don ni sdug bsngal gyi don to zhes bya ba dga' ba'i yul ma yin pa'i don bstan te /
translated: The meaning of “absence of wishes” is the meaning of suffering. This shows the meaning of the object of delight being absent.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba'i rgyu dang gzhi yin pas de la smon cing dga' bar bya ba'i yul ma yin te de ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad ni sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba'i rgyu dang gzhi yin pas de la smon cing dga' bar bya ba'i yul ma yin te de ni sdug bsngal gyi don to //
translated: All dharmas with outflows are the cause and basis for the arising of various kinds of suffering. Therefore, they are not objects of aspiration and delight. This is the meaning of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sgra rab tu bstan pa zhes bya pas sgra tsam du zad pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sgra rab tu bstan pa zhes bya pas sgra tsam du zad pa'i don bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the teaching of the word suffering” teaches the meaning of mere words.

original: sdug bsngal zhe'o zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa nyid sdug bsngal du zad kyi sdug bsngal gyi dngos po gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhe'o zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa nyid sdug bsngal du zad kyi sdug bsngal gyi dngos po gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the expression “suffering” is exhausted in mere words. There is no such thing as suffering.

original: nam mkha' rab tu brjod pa'i don ni zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
analyzed: nam mkha' rab tu brjod pa'i don ni zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i don bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the meaning of the expression space” teaches the meaning of emptiness by nature.

original: gang stong pa de nyid sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: gang stong pa de nyid sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: That which is empty is suffering.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du stong par brjod pa'i don nyid sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du stong par brjod pa'i don nyid sdug bsngal ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression “empty like space” is the meaning of suffering.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'i dbang du byas nas de la bdag med pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa'i dbang du byas nas de la bdag med pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.🔽“Self”

original: bdag ni @262a * //🔽shin tu bdag med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag ni @262a * // shin tu bdag med pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: means

original: bdag rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: the two kinds of self:

original: gzhan gyis brtags pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtags pa dang / gzung ba dang / 'dzin par snang ba'o //
translated: the imputed self and the self that appears as the perceived and the perceiver.

original: bdag de gnyis la bdag gi dngos po med pas na bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag de gnyis la bdag gi dngos po med pas na bdag med pa'o //
translated: Since those two selves do not exist as things, they are selfless.🔽“The meaning of selflessness” is the nonexistence of the two kinds of self.

original: gang bdag med pa'i don de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag rnam pa gnyis med de stong pa'i don de ni gsob bo zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang bdag med pa'i don de ni zhes bya ba ni bdag rnam pa gnyis med de stong pa'i don de ni gsob bo zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: “That meaning is empty” is connected with “hollow” and so on.

original: snying po rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gsob bo //
analyzed: snying po rang bzhin med pa'i phyir gsob bo //
translated: It is hollow because it is essenceless.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir gsog go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis brtag mi bzod pa'i phyir gsog go //
translated: It is fake because it cannot withstand the scrutiny of the eye of wisdom.

original: snang ba tsam yang rgyu rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ya ma brla'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam yang rgyu rkyen la ltos pa'i phyir ya ma brla'o //
translated: It is unreal because it is merely an appearance that depends on causes and conditions.

original: ji ltar snang ba kun yang stong pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba kun yang stong pa yin pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty because all appearances are empty.

original: stong pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong pa'i don ni bdag med pa'i don zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of emptiness is the meaning of selflessness.

original: de bas na bdag dang chos gnyis kyis stong pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid bdag med pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang chos gnyis kyis stong pa'i don gang yin pa de nyid bdag med pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of emptiness of both self and phenomena is the meaning of selflessness.

original: zhi ba'i nga rgyal med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhi ba'i nga rgyal med pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of the absence of the pride of peace,

original: de la zhi pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhi pa'i don gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What is the meaning of peace?” and so forth.

original: zhi ba ni zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Peace is not made peaceful by peace.

original: zhi ba nyid zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la /🔽zhi ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa'am /
analyzed: zhi ba nyid zhi ba'o zhes bya ba la / zhi ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa'am /
translated: Peace itself is peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: Here, “peace” refers to emptiness or nirvana.

original: stong pa 'am mya ngan las 'das pa'i de'i rang bzhin zhi bar rtogs pa'i ye shes kyis zhi ba dang stong par byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa 'am mya ngan las 'das pa'i de'i rang bzhin zhi bar rtogs pa'i ye shes kyis zhi ba dang stong par byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The wisdom that realizes the nature of peace or nirvana is not made peaceful or empty.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ye nas zhi zhing stong pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ye nas zhi zhing stong pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is primordially peaceful and empty by its very essence.

original: ma zhi ba yang zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos 'dus byas kyi dngos po de dag kyang ye shes kyis zhi ba dang stong par rtogs nas zhi zhing med par byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma zhi ba yang zhi bas zhi bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos 'dus byas kyi dngos po de dag kyang ye shes kyis zhi ba dang stong par rtogs nas zhi zhing med par byas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The conditioned things of cyclic existence are not made peaceful and non-existent by the wisdom that understands them to be peaceful and empty.

original: de dag kyang ye nas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes shing zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag kyang ye nas ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes shing zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Rather, they are primordially peaceful by their very essence, unborn.

original: zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the word “peaceful,”

original: gang zhi ba'i don de ni mtshan ma thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhi ba'i don de ni mtshan ma thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “The meaning of peace is the complete pacification of all signs.”

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma thams cad zhi ste med pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan ma thams cad zhi ste med pa de ni zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pacification of all signs of karma, afflictions, and apprehended and apprehender is called “peace.”

original: zhi ba dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach what peace actually is,

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Peace is nirvana.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang phung po spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang phung po spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste zhi ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is the abandonment of afflictions and aggregates, and it is peace.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhi mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The four inexhaustible Dharma summaries have been explained.

original: // / lhun gyis grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / lhun gyis grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the bodhisattvas who are spontaneously accomplished,🔽it is said:

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam mi zad pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the path that is to be traversed by the bodhisattvas alone is inexhaustible.”

original: 'dis bsdus pa'i don rang byang chub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis bsdus pa'i don rang byang chub pa bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates the meaning of the summary that is included in the enlightenment of a solitary buddha.

original: gzhan la mi ltos bar bdag cig pus bla na med pa'i @262b byang chub thob par byed pa ni gcig pus bgrod pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos bar bdag cig pus bla na med pa'i @262b byang chub thob par byed pa ni gcig pus bgrod pa ste /
translated: The path that is to be traversed by the bodhisattvas alone is the attainment of unsurpassed enlightenment by oneself alone, without relying on others.

original: gang de ltar byed pa nyid la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de ltar byed pa nyid la ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is to be traversed by those who act in that way.

original: mi zad pa yang bgrod cing thob par bya ba'i chos mi zad pa'i phyir bgrod par byed pa dang / thob par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa yang bgrod cing thob par bya ba'i chos mi zad pa'i phyir bgrod par byed pa dang / thob par byed pa yang mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is also inexhaustible because the phenomena that are to be traversed and attained are inexhaustible, and the one who traverses and attains is also inexhaustible.

original: lhun gyis grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of bodhisattvas who are spontaneously accomplished.

original: mi g-yeng ba dang / bzod pa thob pa dang / mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yeng ba dang / bzod pa thob pa dang / mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: non-distraction, attainment of patience, abiding in sameness, and being free from obscurations.

original: de la ma g-yeng ba ni /
analyzed: de la ma g-yeng ba ni /
translated: Non-distraction is

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan rnams bdag 'ga' zhig gis thob par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan rnams bdag 'ga' zhig gis thob par bya ba'i phyir rtsom pa ste /
translated: the undertaking of supramundane and mundane qualities in order to attain some state of self.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “on the path to be traversed alone,” and so forth.

original: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam ni theg pa gcig pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam ni theg pa gcig pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path to be traversed alone is the path of the One Vehicle.

original: lam de bsgrub par bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan su la yang mi rten par bdag gcig pus sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lam de bsgrub par bya ba la byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan su la yang mi rten par bdag gcig pus sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: On that path, the bodhisattvas accomplish it alone by themselves without relying on anyone else.

original: theg pa gcig gi lam dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi lam dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the actual path of the One Vehicle,

original: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “on the path to be traversed alone,” and so forth.

original: byang chub tu go cha gyon zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub tu go cha gyon zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub tu sems bskyed cing brtson 'grus rtsom ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase armored for enlightenment means that one generates the thought of enlightenment and undertakes effort in order to attain unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: bdag gis rtson 'grus ni dge ba byed pa la sems spro ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis rtson 'grus ni dge ba byed pa la sems spro ba'o //
translated: Effort is the enthusiasm of mind for the performance of virtue.

original: mthu ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad byed mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni bdud la sogs pas bar chad byed mi nus pa'o //
translated: Power is the inability of Mara and others to create obstacles.

original: stobs ni me los mi tshugs pa'o //🔽gzhan gyi go skabs med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stobs ni me los mi tshugs pa'o // gzhan gyi go skabs med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Strength is the inability of others to overpower one.

original: gzhan gyis grogs bya mi dgos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis grogs bya mi dgos par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase without relying on another means that one does not need the assistance of others.

original: bdag gi mthu stobs kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mthus 'byung zhing kun la khyad zhugs par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi mthu stobs kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mthus 'byung zhing kun la khyad zhugs par bya ste zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase through my own power and strength means that one should be distinguished by one's own power and should be independent of others.

original: sems can thams cad kyis yongs su thob par bya ba ni gang rig pa'i gnas dang / bzo'i gnas dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis yongs su thob par bya ba ni gang rig pa'i gnas dang / bzo'i gnas dang / longs spyod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase to be attained by all sentient beings refers to the objects of knowledge, the arts, enjoyments, etc.

original: gang 'phags pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag go //🔽theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa ni dang po nyid du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' sa la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dag go // theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa ni dang po nyid du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: “All the noble ones” refers to the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas who have entered the levels, and the tathāgatas.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: “Those who have newly entered the vehicle” are the bodhisattvas who have first generated the thought of awakening or who have entered the level of practice through faith.

original: thob par bya ba ni de dag gis thob par bya ba'i yon tan dran ba nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni de dag gis thob par bya ba'i yon tan dran ba nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag pa'i spong ba la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: “What is to be attained” are the qualities to be attained by them, such as the thirty-seven factors of awakening, such as the applications of mindfulness and the correct abandonments, the levels, the perfections,

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs @263a * //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs @263a * //
translated: the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: pa'o ; / bzod pa thob pa ni bdag nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su sbyong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o ; / bzod pa thob pa ni bdag nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su sbyong bar byed pa ste /
translated: “Those who have attained acceptance” are those who are purifying the perfections themselves.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With respect to them,

original: sbyin pa ni bdag gi grogs ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni bdag gi grogs ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Generosity is not my friend, and so on.

original: de'i don ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gis bdag bsgrub cing las su rung bar bya ba ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: de'i don ni pha rol tu phyin pa de dag gis bdag bsgrub cing las su rung bar bya ba ma yin gyi ;
translated: The meaning of that is: I am not to be accomplished and made fit by those perfections.

original: bdag gis de dag bsgrub cing mthar dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis de dag bsgrub cing mthar dbyung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: I must accomplish and perfect them.

original: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: By abiding in equality, one accomplishes the means of attracting disciples, the Dharma that ripens all sentient beings.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that in mind,

original: bdag la bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag la bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it says, “I will attract disciples with the means of attraction,” and so on.

original: de dag gi don kyang snga ma bzhin du lta'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don kyang snga ma bzhin du lta'o //
translated: The meaning of those is to be understood as before.

original: sgrib pa med pa ni bdag gcig pus bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i bgegs rnams 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa ni bdag gcig pus bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa'i bar du gcod pa'i bgegs rnams 'joms pa ste /
translated: Absence of obscurations is the destruction of the hindrances to attaining unsurpassed enlightenment by oneself alone.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With that in mind,🔽it says,

original: gang 'di lta bu'i chos la grogs med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i chos la grogs med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This is what is meant by in this way, the Dharma is without a companion, etc.

original: 'di lta bu'i chos ni gong du bshad pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i chos ni gong du bshad pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yon tan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po la sogs pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang rgya ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The Dharma in this way is the qualities of the mundane and supramundane perfections, the means of unification, etc., and the qualities that will be explained below, such as the enlightenment of buddhahood.

original: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: By wisdom refers to nonconceptual intuition.

original: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam mi zad pa bshad zin to /
analyzed: gcig pu bgrod pa'i lam mi zad pa bshad zin to /
translated: The path of progress for the solitary has been explained.

original: // / bya ba byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: // / bya ba byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who performs the function is of four types:

original: ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang / gcod pa dang / 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang / 'jug pa dang / gcod pa dang / 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: the teacher, the one who engages, the one who cuts, and the one who joins.

original: de la ston pa ni sems can rnams la skyes bu chen po bzhin mos shing skyes bu'i bya ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la ston pa ni sems can rnams la skyes bu chen po bzhin mos shing skyes bu'i bya ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, the teacher is one who has faith in the great being of sentient beings and knows the means of the activities of a great being.

original: 'jug pa ni rtogs par chud pa'i thabs shes pa'o //🔽gcod pa ni drang ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rtogs par chud pa'i thabs shes pa'o // gcod pa ni drang ba'i thabs shes pa'o //
translated: Engagement is the knowledge of the means of entering into realization.🔽Severing is the knowledge of the means of guiding.

original: 'dogs par byed pa ni bstan pa'i tshul gyis yongs su smin pa'i thabs shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dogs par byed pa ni bstan pa'i tshul gyis yongs su smin pa'i thabs shes pa ste /
translated: Designation is the knowledge of the means of ripening by the method of teaching.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that,

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mi zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, moreover, for the bodhisattvas, the means are inexhaustible.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on is said.

original: 'dis bsdus pa'i don chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis bsdus pa'i don chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba bstan to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the wheel of the Dharma is fully turned.

original: thabs mi zad pa yang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thabs mi zad pa yang thabs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams mi zad pa'i phyir /
translated: The means are inexhaustible because the phenomena to be accomplished by the means are inexhaustible.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs kyang mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i thabs kyang mi zad pa'o //
translated: The means for accomplishing them are also inexhaustible.

original: thabs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas @263b kyi chos thams cad rnam par sgrub cing slong ba ste de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas @263b kyi chos thams cad rnam par sgrub cing slong ba ste de zhes bya ba la /
translated: By what means do bodhisattvas accomplish and attain all the qualities of the buddhas?

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //🔽rnam par sgrub pa ni ma grub pa'am /🔽ma skyes pa la sgrub ba 'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o // rnam par sgrub pa ni ma grub pa'am / ma skyes pa la sgrub ba 'am /
translated: The Buddha-qualities are the perfections, the elements leading to enlightenment, etc.🔽Accomplishment is the bringing about of what has not been accomplished,

original: skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: or the production of what has not yet been produced.

original: slong ba ni skyes pa rnams gong du 'phel bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: slong ba ni skyes pa rnams gong du 'phel bar byed pa ste /
translated: Increase is the augmentation of what has been produced.

original: des na thabs so ;
analyzed: des na thabs so ;
translated: Thus, these are the means.

original: / tshig 'di ni mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: / tshig 'di ni mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: These terms are the brief presentation.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub cing slong bar byed pa'i bshad pa'o //🔽thabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad nye bar gzhog pa zhes bya ba ni thabs ni lha dang mir skye ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas pa 'am /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sgrub cing slong bar byed pa'i bshad pa'o // thabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i chos thams cad nye bar gzhog pa zhes bya ba ni thabs ni lha dang mir skye ba'i dge ba'i chos rnams la gnas pa 'am /
translated: The rest is the explanation of how the Buddha-qualities are accomplished and increased.🔽The means is the establishment of all the bodhisattva’s virtuous qualities.

original: de la goms par byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la goms par byed pa'i don to //
translated: The means is the establishment of the virtuous qualities leading to rebirth as a god or human, or the cultivation of those.

original: bsam pa nges par sems zhes bya ba ni sems kyis chos rnams la rtog cing gtan la 'bebs pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsam pa nges par sems zhes bya ba ni sems kyis chos rnams la rtog cing gtan la 'bebs pa'i don to //
translated: The determination of the will is the investigation and ascertainment of the teachings by the mind.

original: sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis dge ba'i chos la rgyun mi 'chad par spyod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis dge ba'i chos la rgyun mi 'chad par spyod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the practice is uninterrupted” means that one practices the virtuous qualities with body and speech in an uninterrupted manner.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas bye brag tu 'phags pa'i chos 'dod ces bya ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos las bye brag tu 'phags pa theg pa chen po'i chos la sems thag pa nas dad pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas bye brag tu 'phags pa'i chos 'dod ces bya ba'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos las bye brag tu 'phags pa theg pa chen po'i chos la sems thag pa nas dad pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “the superior attitude is the desire for the Dharma that is superior” means that one has faith in the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, which is superior to the Dharma of the disciples and solitary realizers.

original: thabs ni sbyin pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pus pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs te /
analyzed: thabs ni sbyin pas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed ces bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pus pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni thabs te /
translated: The phrase “the method is the completion of all the perfections through generosity” means that the completion of all six perfections through the perfection of generosity alone is the method.

original: de la zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la zang zing gi sbyin pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the perfection of generosity is completed through the generosity of material things.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed do //
translated: By the gift of fearlessness, one perfects the transcendences of morality and tolerance.

original: chos sbyin pas ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de //
analyzed: chos sbyin pas ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed de //
translated: By the gift of the teaching, one perfects the transcendences of effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyis skye ba thams cad 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rnam par smin pa mtho ris su nges kyang thabs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi don spyad pa'i phyir mtho ris 'ba' zhig tu skye bar ma zad kyi skye ba thams cad du
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis skye ba thams cad 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rnam par smin pa mtho ris su nges kyang thabs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi don spyad pa'i phyir mtho ris 'ba' zhig tu skye bar ma zad kyi skye ba thams cad du
translated: By morality, one takes up all births. The maturation of pure morality is certain in heaven, but by the power of skillful means, one does not just take birth in heaven for the sake of beings, but in all kinds of births.

original: 'byung ba'o // thabs ni bzod pas byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba'o // thabs ni bzod pas byang chub kyi phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Skillful means is the cause of enlightenment.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pas /
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pas /
translated: One who is tolerant

original: lus bzang ba dang / ngag snyan pa dang / sems dang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus bzang ba dang / ngag snyan pa dang / sems dang bar 'gyur te /
translated: has a good body, a sweet voice, and a clear mind.

original: lus dang ngag yid dang ba de sems can gzhan gyis mthong zhing thos na dad cing byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur bas kyang byang chub kyi phyir //
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid dang ba de sems can gzhan gyis mthong zhing thos na dad cing byang chub tu sems bskyed par 'gyur bas kyang byang chub kyi phyir //
translated: And when other beings see and hear that purity of body, speech, and mind, they conceive the spirit of enlightenment and are confirmed in enlightenment.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems @264a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems @264a * //
translated: The continuity of body, speech, and mind

original: kyi rgyun ces bya'o //🔽brtson 'grus kyi 'jug pa dang / gnas pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kyi rgyun ces bya'o // brtson 'grus kyi 'jug pa dang / gnas pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: is called the “continuity of the three.”🔽The verse speaks of “the engagement of effort” and “the effort of abiding.”

original: 'jug pa la brtson pa dang / gnas pa la brtson pa zhes brtson pa'i tshig gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa la brtson pa dang / gnas pa la brtson pa zhes brtson pa'i tshig gnyi ga dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “effort” should be applied to both.

original: de la 'jug pa la brtson pa ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa la brtson pa ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po rtsom pa'o //
translated: The effort of engagement is the first undertaking of the wholesome roots that are the cause of enlightenment.

original: gnas pa la brtson pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa mthar phyin pa'o //🔽bsam gtan gyis bsam gtan las phyir ldog pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi khams gong ma dag tu skyes kyang /
analyzed: gnas pa la brtson pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba brtsams pa mthar phyin pa'o // bsam gtan gyis bsam gtan las phyir ldog pa shes pa ni bsam gtan gyi khams gong ma dag tu skyes kyang /
translated: The effort of abiding is the completion of the wholesome roots that have been undertaken.

original: thabs kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba len par byed pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of turning back from the meditative concentrations is the taking up of birth in the realm of desire by one who has been born in the higher meditative concentrations, by the power of skillful means.

original: shes rab kyis 'dus ma byas spong ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis 'dus ma byas rtogs kyang /
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'dus ma byas spong ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis 'dus ma byas rtogs kyang /
translated: “By means of wisdom, one avoids the unconditioned” means that, by means of wisdom, one realizes the unconditioned,

original: thabs kyis zin pas 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings la mi gnas shing 'dus byas kyi bya ba rnams kyang byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis zin pas 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings la mi gnas shing 'dus byas kyi bya ba rnams kyang byed pa'o //
translated: but, by means of skillful means, one does not remain in the unconditioned realm and also performs conditioned activities.

original: byams pas dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal myong ba dang rnam par grol ba mthong ba ni dpung gnyen med pa ste /
analyzed: byams pas dpung gnyen med pa rnams kyi skyabs zhes bya ba ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal myong ba dang rnam par grol ba mthong ba ni dpung gnyen med pa ste /
translated: “By means of love, one protects those who have no protector” means that those who experience the suffering of the lower realms and those who do not see liberation are without a protector.

original: de dag skye 'gro dang rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i skyabs byed pa ni thabs so //🔽snying rjes 'khor ba la mi smod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag skye 'gro dang rnam par grol ba'i bde ba thob pa'i skyabs byed pa ni thabs so // snying rjes 'khor ba la mi smod ces bya ba la /
translated: To be their protector and help them attain the happiness of birth in the higher realms and liberation is skillful means.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rjes 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin yang smod par mi byed pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa'i snying rjes 'khor ba sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin yang smod par mi byed pa ni thabs so //
translated: “By means of compassion, one does not disparage saṃsāra” means that, by means of compassion, which removes the suffering of sentient beings, one does not disparage saṃsāra, even though it is the abode of suffering.🔽This is skillful means.

original: dga' bas dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la mi 'byed pa zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: dga' bas dga' ba dang mi dga' ba la mi 'byed pa zhes bya ba la ;
translated: “By means of joy, one does not discriminate between the pleasant and the unpleasant” means that,

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin sdug bsngal zhing mi dga' ba can yin yang thabs kyi dbang gis de la ji mi snyam pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba dang / 'khor ba'i rang bzhin sdug bsngal zhing mi dga' ba can yin yang thabs kyi dbang gis de la ji mi snyam pa ni thabs so //
translated: The joy of the joy of the Dharma, and the indifference to the nature of cyclic existence which is not delightful, although it is not delightful, is the method.

original: btang snyoms kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs thams cad 'phel zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs thams cad 'phel zhes bya ba la /
translated: The statement through equanimity, the roots of virtue and all the collections increase

original: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin ji 'ang mi spyod pa yin pa las /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi rang bzhin ji 'ang mi spyod pa yin pa las /
translated: means that the nature of equanimity is to not engage in anything at all.

original: thabs kyi dbang gis btang snyoms kyi dus na btang snyoms las kyang ma nyams la /
analyzed: thabs kyi dbang gis btang snyoms kyi dus na btang snyoms las kyang ma nyams la /
translated: However, through the power of the method, at the time of equanimity, one does not fall from equanimity,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshegs 'phel bar byed pa'i spyod pa yang mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshegs 'phel bar byed pa'i spyod pa yang mi gtong ba'o //
translated: and one does not abandon the practice of increasing the collections of roots of virtue, merit, and wisdom.

original: lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan thob ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan thob pa yang thabs te /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan thob ba zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi spyan thob pa yang thabs te /
translated: The statement through the divine eye, one obtains the eye of the Buddha means that the divine eye of the bodhisattva is the method for obtaining the eye of the Buddha.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to the remaining perfections.

original: thabs ni sems can dag gi bsam pa rnams la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ji 'dra bar shes pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: thabs ni sems can dag gi bsam pa rnams la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ji 'dra bar shes pa ni thabs so //
translated: The method is the engagement with the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: thabs ni spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thabs ni spyod pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The method is the knowledge of the characteristics of conduct.

original: de ltar @264b sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pas sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa che chung gi spyod pa rnams shes pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: de ltar @264b sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes pas sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa che chung gi spyod pa rnams shes pa ni thabs so //
translated: Thus, through knowing the thoughts of sentient beings, the knowledge of the conduct of sentient beings' great and small afflictions such as desire is the method.

original: rgal nas 'jug pa ni bsam gtan la sogs pas gong ma rnams su phyin kyang thabs kyi dbang gis de nas slar ldog cing sa 'og ma dag tu 'jog cing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgal nas 'jug pa ni bsam gtan la sogs pas gong ma rnams su phyin kyang thabs kyi dbang gis de nas slar ldog cing sa 'og ma dag tu 'jog cing spyod pa'o //
translated: Having crossed over, to engage means that although one has gone to the higher [realms] through dhyana and so forth, through the power of method, one turns back from there and engages in the lower realms.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni she bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /🔽nyon mongs pa med par gyur kyang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni she bya dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /🔽nyon mongs pa med par gyur kyang /
translated: The afflictions are called thoroughly afflicted because of the afflictions and the obscurations of afflictions.

original: sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na spyod cing nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'khor ba na spyod cing nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: They are afflicted because they experience samsara for the sake of sentient beings.

original: khur bor bas khur khyer pa ni phung po lnga'i khur bor te /
analyzed: khur bor bas khur khyer pa ni phung po lnga'i khur bor te /
translated: They carry a load, because they have cast off the load of the five aggregates.

original: zag pa med par gyur kyang thabs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi don spyod cing phung po'i khur len pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med par gyur kyang thabs kyi dbang gis sems can gyi don spyod cing phung po'i khur len pa'o //
translated: Even though they have become free from the outflows, they take up the load of the aggregates in order to experience samsara for the sake of sentient beings, by the power of their method.

original: tshad yod par tshad med par ston pa ni chos kyi mdo bzhi lta bu la sogs pa tshad yod pa dag las sems kyi spyod pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: tshad yod par tshad med par ston pa ni chos kyi mdo bzhi lta bu la sogs pa tshad yod pa dag las sems kyi spyod pa dang sbyar te /
translated: They teach immeasurably from the measured, such as the four summaries of the Dharma, by applying the mind to the measured.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pa tshad med par ston cing 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pa tshad med par ston cing 'chad pa'o //
translated: They teach and explain the immeasurable, such as the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: tshad med pa tshad yod par ston pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: tshad med pa tshad yod par ston pa ni chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong la sogs pa yang /
translated: They teach the measured from the immeasurable, such as the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma.

original: chos kyi mdo bzhir nyung dur bsdus nas 'chad pa'o //🔽dbang po zhan pa rnams la gsal bar byed pa ni dbang po rtul po rnams la yang ston /
analyzed: chos kyi mdo bzhir nyung dur bsdus nas 'chad pa'o //🔽dbang po zhan pa rnams la gsal bar byed pa ni dbang po rtul po rnams la yang ston /
translated: They explain them by condensing them into the four summaries of the Dharma.🔽They clarify for those with weak faculties, such as the four summaries of the Dharma, for those with dull faculties.

original: mkhas pa'i thabs kyis don dka' ba rnams gsal bar go bar byed pa 'am /
analyzed: mkhas pa'i thabs kyis don dka' ba rnams gsal bar go bar byed pa 'am /
translated: The wise use skillful means to clarify difficult points.🔽

original: dbang po rno bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rno bar byed pa'o //
translated: The skillful means of the wise is to clarify and make understandable difficult points, or to sharpen the faculties.

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ni bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dus la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ni bya ba dang mi bya ba'i dus la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the proper and improper times is skill in the times for action and nonaction.

original: lam nas lam ngan par 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: lam nas lam ngan par 'gro ba ni /
translated: Going by the wrong path while on the path is

original: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas kyang 'khor ba'i lam du yang 'gro ba'o //🔽myur du las mang po byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po chung du yang bsam pa dag pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas mang po dang 'bras bu chen po thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la gnas kyang 'khor ba'i lam du yang 'gro ba'o // myur du las mang po byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dngos po chung du yang bsam pa dag pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas mang po dang 'bras bu chen po thob par byed pa'o //
translated: to go by the path of cyclic existence while abiding in the path of the aryas.🔽Quickly performing many actions is to make a little thing of generosity and so on into a great deal and to obtain a great result by dedicating it with a pure intention to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: mang po las tshad med par byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po chen po bsngo ba yongs su dag pas tshad med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mang po las tshad med par byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po chen po bsngo ba yongs su dag pas tshad med par byed pa'o //
translated: Performing immeasurably from the many is to make a great deal of generosity and so on into an immeasurable amount by dedicating it with a pure attitude.

original: bye ba'i sems can rnams 'dum par byed pa ni sems can phan tshun bye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bar gyur pa rnams 'dum par byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bye ba'i sems can rnams 'dum par byed pa ni sems can phan tshun bye ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang bral bar gyur pa rnams 'dum par byed cing dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: The reconciliation of beings who are divided is the reconciliation of beings who are divided among themselves and the establishment of those who are separated from the root of virtue in the root of virtue.

original: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab la gnas pa ni sems can rab 'bring gsum dang mthun par spyod cing ston pa'o //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i rig pa las 'khor ba'i @265a * //
analyzed: tha ma dang 'bring dang rab la gnas pa ni sems can rab 'bring gsum dang mthun par spyod cing ston pa'o // mya ngan las 'das pa'i rig pa las 'khor ba'i @265a * //
translated: The practice in accordance with the inferior, middling and superior is the practice and teaching in accordance with the three types of beings, inferior, middling and superior.

original: rigs par ltung ba ni mya ngan las 'da' bar sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: rigs par ltung ba ni mya ngan las 'da' bar sbyor ba'am /
translated: The falling into the reasoning of samsara from the reasoning of nirvana is the practice or conduct that is directed towards nirvana.

original: spyod pas mya ngan las 'da' ba thob kyang /
analyzed: spyod pas mya ngan las 'da' ba thob kyang /
translated: Although one attains nirvana through practice or conduct,

original: de ni mi gnas par 'khor ba yang spyod cing 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mi gnas par 'khor ba yang spyod cing 'jug pa'o //
translated: one does not remain there but also engages in and practices samsara.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir sbyor ba'am spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni skabs 'dir sbyor ba'am spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: Reasoning in this context refers to practice or conduct.

original: thar pa las bcings pa tshol ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bcings pa las thar kyang sems can gyi don spyod pa la thabs kyis nyon mongs pa dang bcas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa las bcings pa tshol ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i bcings pa las thar kyang sems can gyi don spyod pa la thabs kyis nyon mongs pa dang bcas par ston pa'o //
translated: Seeking bondage from liberation means that even though one is liberated from the bondage of the afflictions and so forth, one displays the possession of afflictions through skillful means in order to engage in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: shes bya zad par byed de /
analyzed: shes bya zad par byed de /
translated: One exhausts the objects of knowledge.

original: shes bya zad par yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos shes par bya ba rnams zad cing stong bar chud kyang thabs kyis kun du spyad pa mi gtong ba'i phyir stong pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya zad par yang mi ltung zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos shes par bya ba rnams zad cing stong bar chud kyang thabs kyis kun du spyad pa mi gtong ba'i phyir stong pa'i mthar yang mi ltung ba'o //
translated: And yet one does not fall into the extreme of emptiness means that even though one exhausts and realizes the emptiness of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena that are to be known, one does not fall into the extreme of emptiness because one does not abandon the practice of skillful means.

original: spyod lam thams cad 'khrug par byed pa la spyod lam rnams las kyang mi nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad 'khrug par byed pa la spyod lam rnams las kyang mi nyams so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One engages in all kinds of conduct, and yet one does not fall away from one's conduct.

original: thabs kyis sems can gyi don spyod pa'i tshe bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i spyod pa las langs kyang bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi don las nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thabs kyis sems can gyi don spyod pa'i tshe bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i spyod pa las langs kyang bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi don las nyams par yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even when one rises from the conduct of meditative concentration and so forth in order to engage in the welfare of sentient beings through skillful means, one does not fall away from the meaning of meditative concentration and so forth.

original: sems can la lta ba'i tshul khrims lam yin pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ltar thabs med pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can la lta ba'i tshul khrims lam yin pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa ltar thabs med pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The morality of viewing sentient beings is the path, but it is not like the arya sravakas and so on who lack the means.

original: sems can gyi don du spyod pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yin pas sems can gyi don mthong na /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du spyod pa nyid byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yin pas sems can gyi don mthong na /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is the very practice for the sake of sentient beings. Therefore, if one sees the benefit for sentient beings,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la mi lta'o //🔽bsdu bas lta ba la brten cing rtsod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams bsdu zhing drang ba'i phyir don mthun par spyad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'dul zhing drang bar bya ba'i sems can de dag gi lta ba yang phyogs shing🔽rten gyi mu stegs can la sogs pa ltar lta ba des mchog tu 'dzin cing rtsod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la mi lta'o // bsdu bas lta ba la brten cing rtsod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnams bsdu zhing drang ba'i phyir don mthun par spyad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas 'dul zhing drang bar bya ba'i sems can de dag gi lta ba yang phyogs shing rten gyi mu stegs can la sogs pa ltar lta ba des mchog tu 'dzin cing rtsod pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: one does not rely on the pratimoksa vow.

original: sgra 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad brjod du med par rtogs kyang /
analyzed: sgra 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad brjod du med par rtogs kyang /
